data.what_is: Braze is a leading customer engagement platform that powers lasting connections between consumers and brands they love. Braze allows any marketer to collect and take action on any amount of data from any source, so they can creatively engage with customers in real time, across channels from one platform. From cross-channel messaging and journey orchestration to Al-powered experimentation and optimization, Braze enables companies to build and maintain absolutely engaging relationships with their customers that foster growth and loyalty. The company has been recognized as a 2024 U.S. News Best Technology Companies to Work For, is a 2023 UK Best Workplace for Women by Great Place to Work, and was named a Leader by Gartner(r) in the 2023 Magic Quadrant(tm) for Multichannel Marketing Hubs and in The Forrester Wave(tm): Cross-Channel Marketing Hubs, Q1 2023. Braze is headquartered in New York with 10+ offices across North America, Europe, and APAC. Learn more at braze.com.
data.product_description: Create powerful customer engagement with ease, at any scaleLaunch your marketing into the future with the platform purpose-built for customer engagement. Leading brands worldwide rely on our vertically integrated solution to bring relevant and meaningful customer experiences to life. Braze customers can start anywhere and go everywhere with our flexible, open ecosystem and a host of channels to choose from.* Listen: At the top of our stack, brands ingest data and listen to customers across multiple digital touchpoints.* Understand: Gain context around customer preferences and behaviors to make every message more relevant. Leverage data to classify audiences, personalize messages, and orchestrate and test campaigns--all in real time.* Act: Test and act on your insights in the moment. Braze makes it easy to send each customer the right message, on the right channel, at the right time.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great for unlocking cross-channel CRM activity
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We've been able to create cross-channel CRM activity for the first time, driving incremental uplift compared to our previous technologies, e.g. Abandon Basket. We've seen particular success in our mobile activity as it utilises the Braze SDK and connects into our business ecosystem very neatly. It's allowed our teams to unlock ambitious Use Cases to drive purchase frequency and marketing permissions.

The UI is very intuitive and it's easy for new users to onboard to the platform, plus there's a host of online learning material.

The team is always available, highly responsive and authentic in their culture.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Your data needs to be well organised before it gets into Braze. For us, that means having a CDP to collect and organise data before we send it to Braze This does bring complexity into the stack and needs additional expertise to operate.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Enabling all our CRM channels to trigger off the same data in a unified way - this has consolidated the number of vendors in our business and given our teams the ability to create cross-channel marketing activity

2. Enabling our mobile team to drive App spend and frequency using real-time updates, content and rewards

3. It's forcing a change in our thinking / process to be data-led and customer-led, rather than channel-led

initial_reviews.review_title: Irreplaceable MMP that allows our team to provide personalized user experiences w/o devs
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We've used Braze for 2+ years and it's unlocked so much for us in terms of being able to provide personalized in app experiences for our users without relying on devs.
- Documentation is always super detailed and helpful
- Constantly improving the platform with new features (they launched AI features like Copy Assistant, image generation, etc. before ChatGPT became the next hot tech)
- They listen to product feedback - we had a use case that required being able to have an array of user attributes and while it took some time, they added the feature into the platform
- Easy to use interface - our marketing team leverages it all the time

What do you dislike about Braze?
There aren't a ton of downsides I can think of. We definitely have some unique use cases in our business that we've had to build workarounds for, but Braze has been great at constantly updating their platform to include new features.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Personalized marketing messages
Sending user the right message at the right time (with intelligent timing)
Automating processes that we previously did manually
Understanding our customer segments better
Being able to push in app messages without engineering support

initial_reviews.review_title: Braze has been a game changer for Hayu!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I love that it's user friendly and we're able to implement new features relatively quickly to achieve a personalised, best in class multi-channel CRM journey for our audiences. We use Braze every single day and it's so easy to integrate new things such as catalogs and data fields. I like that our account manager is always on hand to support with any issues and recommend ways we can optimise our campaign or canvas performance.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting side of Braze can be a bit tricky to manage. There are several ways that we can create a report. Some of the quicker report builds have a limit of comparing 5-10 campaigns/canvases at once, which can be a bit frustrating.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is allowing us to maximise the use of our first party data in order to deliver a personalised customer journey to our audiences through the use of liquid script, connected content and catalogs.

initial_reviews.review_title: Very easy to implement and great features out-of-the-box
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We migrated to Braze in 2023 as we moved away from two legacy systems and consolodated into Braze technology stack. We were able to fully implement into our product in around 3 months across 11 platforms thanks to great documentation and onboarding process.
The features that come out out-of-the-box were easy to integrate into our applications and clearly defined in documentation in terms SDK support.
For anything we have issues or concerns with the customer support team are excellent in coming back swiftly to help troubleshoot and diagnose the issue.
Our CRM team constantly praises the ease of use as something that is intuitive and they very rarely face issue setting up email and in-app messaging campaigns that they set up on a regular basis.
Braze offers some functions that allow customisation through a feature called content cards and we've found great success with this in recent months.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There isn't much to dislike about Braze, however sometimes the support teams can struggle to understand the issue reported if it's specific to product integration. However having a customer support manager allows us to escalate such cases and they can utilise their knowledge of the integration to help speed up support.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Braze to help reach our customers at the right time with the right message to ensure we engage and retain them.
With the help of the plethora of features available and the ability to personalise on scale we have been able to create multiple messaging channels within our apps including bespoke placements.

initial_reviews.review_title: I would recommend Braze to someone who is looking for Customer Engagement Platform.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
For me as a person who works more on the setup side, it is easy to integrate Braze into our tech stack, as it offers a wide variety of ways of loading data, be it Snowflake Cloud Data Ingestion, API, or just manual CSV uploads. On top of that, documentation is well-developed and offers pre-made solutions for certain issues that just work. No need to spend time coming up with solutions, when Braze offers one already.
Once the data is loaded, it is very easy to see users and create segments, even if it is just for testing purposes, if the data is successfully loaded. Intuitive UI, especially the new one.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The lack of logs for many processes would be my main issue. When updating data in Braze, it tells you that an error is there, but not information on the details of the error.
Additionally, with the updated UI, daily use-case issues are easier to find, but some niche things have become harder to find and sometimes cause me to switch back to the old UI to observe that.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solves the problem or marketing channel automation, be it SMS, Push Notifications, or Emails. Just keep the data updated and the rest will work well.
It is as strong as your data is and with how easy it is to load new data into Braze, the possibilities are plentiful.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer:
For me as a person who works more on the setup side, it is easy to integrate Braze into our tech stack, as it offers a wide variety of ways of loading data, be it Snowflake Cloud Data Ingestion, API, or just manual CSV uploads. On top of that, documentation is well-developed and offers pre-made solutions for certain issues that just work. No need to spend time coming up with solutions, when Braze offers one already.
Once the data is loaded, it is very easy to see users and create segments, even if it is just for testing purposes, if the data is successfully loaded. Intuitive UI, especially the new one.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer:
The lack of logs for many processes would be my main issue. When updating data in Braze, it tells you that an error is there, but not information on the details of the error.
Additionally, with the updated UI, daily use-case issues are easier to find, but some niche things have become harder to find and sometimes cause me to switch back to the old UI to observe that.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
Braze solves the problem or marketing channel automation, be it SMS, Push Notifications, or Emails. Just keep the data updated and the rest will work well.
It is as strong as your data is and with how easy it is to load new data into Braze, the possibilities are plentiful.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great product with some minor limitations
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a really easy to use tool and has some great features that can take your marketing to next level! The ease in which you can set up a campaign to multiple channels is great for new comers and experienced marketers alike. It speeds up creating campaigns, tests and optimisation by almost 100%!

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is missing some features that you'd expect from a tool of this size. There are some features that are not editable that I believe should be. The data point restriction can also be a downside as it can become very expensive and with the fixation on data comes more filter  limitations.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is solving our problem of multi-channel marketing. Making it easy for us to talk to customers across more than just email. This will help streamline our marketing.

initial_reviews.review_title: Braze is a great platform to engage with your customers through many channels
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is very powerful in orchestrating marketing and service messages across different channels such as in-app messages, push notifications, sms, email and web messages. It does not require technical skills to set up a journey which has many decision points. My record of creating a campaign with an audience is within 12 minutes, so you can create a campaign while listening to Ravel's Bolero 

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze data model looks at user level, not at account level. If you want to target an audience that has a specific profile or behaviour within the account (so not attributed to your account contact person, but to the behaviour of the users within that account) then you need to prepare the data more than you would have to do compared to other engagement software. This makes Braze less suitable for B2B corporate use cases.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We inform our customers about our products and services. We stimulate them to use our app more and in the right way. By using a variety of different channels, our reach is great, the response is verty well and the impact is measurable.

initial_reviews.review_title: So powerful it's energizing my entire career
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Understanding and enhancing your customer profiles, then acting on that data, is easier in this platform than in any other platform I've worked with. The native functionality with web and apps through SDKs not only enables near real-time data capture, but also powers modern marketing channels - In App, Push, and Content Cards!

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sometimes the email drag and drop creator doesn't meet all of my content creation goals, but I think new features are always improving the platform! Plus, I can download the HTML of blocks that need adjusting and do a blended email with drag+drop and custom HTML to meet those goals.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solves the problem of needing day-to-day developer support to complete marketing initiatives.
Once the Braze SDKs are implemented you can action on all of the rich customer data.

initial_reviews.review_title: Multichannel Campaign Capabilities
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The main reason for us to drive through Braze was the comprehensive cross-channel personalization ability. They provide multichannel messaging with personalization and cross-channel orchestration capabilities. We are also able to leverage experimentation features frequently while launching brand-new campaigns. It's easy to distribute messages to multiple/desired channels within the same campaign.
I also like the intelligent timing and intelligent channel targeting features. This helps us to optimize when to send a message to a user and through which channel. Both features help us to achieve the user engagement goals with our messaging.
They also improve their product constantly by adding roadmap items coming as requests from their customers. We still have regular check-ins with their team to discuss our additional needs. It's good to see that our requests are being enabled within the product over time.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Complex multichannel campaign management UI caused marketers to have difficulties setting up campaigns and monitoring campaign health through canvasses in the past. Even though canvases look like a perfect solution to manage everything in a user flow, the UI led marketers to ask for engineering help to validate campaign data often. Since the team has been using the product for a long time, we have figured out internal policies to reduce this operational effort, also once people get used to it the additional requests are reduced over time. I think clear guides and comprehensive campaign reporting would help reduce these operational issues.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is powerful in managing campaigns across different channels with comprehensive personalization abilities. We have been using it for the last 2,5 years for cross-channel messaging activities. We started to use it with only D2C email and mobile push messaging, then extended it to B2B messaging and additional channels easily. Because Braze allows us to experiment with new ideas effectively and improve our marketing capabilities with a widely integrated solution.
Even though we have had issues with operational usage along the way and don't find it 100% user-friendly, we could resolve all the problems that led us to choose this product in the first place.

initial_reviews.review_title: Bra\e has taken our marketing to a new level
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The customer support and learning academy at Braze is fantastic, our account manager is very helpful and many users of Braze within our team make use of the learning academy to get to grips with the product. Braze also bringing all our customer info into one place to manage those relationships is also very useful and the reporting functionality has helped us get a better understanding of how our marketing is performing

What do you dislike about Braze?
It can be difficult to understand at first and without prior experience with CRM softwares it can be quite confusing which can impact your experience when getting started, however once you get going the tools are very intuiative. It being complicated to use also meant it took a bit longer for us to integrate into our team and can make its implementation into business processes a bit harder particularly when bringing on new users.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze has helped us take our marketing to the next level, whether that be through the use of automation and canvases to help re engage customers or just managing campaigns and reporting on performance. Braze has also helped us understand the effectiveness of marketing even more and allows us to reflect and test easily. The abiltiy to integrate with our internal systems has also been fantastic and has made our overall integration much easier.

initial_reviews.review_title: Modern platform for mobile apps and strong professional services
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Robust mix of endpoint APIs, enabling both standalone solutions and complex automations.
Strong professional service team facilitating feature adoption, ticket support, and long-term technical vision and improvements.
Commendable leadership in tech and customer success, bridging the gap between product and CRM.
Strong focus on mobile, offering excellent features for push notifications and email.
Significant improvements in dashboard reporting over the past year, particularly beneficial for brands with limited resources to explore data exporting.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Minimal customization offered by the dashboard and out-of-the-box product and solutions. Addressing specific requirements might take over six months.
Changes related to SCIM endpoints, Global Control Group, or specific endpoints might require months of exploration and decision-making.
Need for more in-product channels and capabilities to reduce the silos between product and CRM and synchronize communications.
Content Cards require further evolution to function more as a real estate placement.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a user, Braze has been instrumental in scaling our lifecycle automation and implementing High-Value Areas (HVAs) strategies. It has enabled us to create sophisticated customer segmentation, leading to more targeted and efficient marketing campaigns. The platform's GenAI feature has been particularly useful in personalizing customer experiences. Additionally, Braze's dynamic content via APIs has allowed us to create more flexible and responsive campaigns. Overall, Braze has significantly enhanced our CRM capabilities.

initial_reviews.review_title: Revolutionizing Customer Engagement with Braze!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The best thing that I love about Braze is its multi-channel marketing which allows us to engage with our customers in various channels like e-mails, in-app messages, and push notifications. It has the ability to integrate with third-party tools such as salesforce, and visualization tools makes it more usable. The data analytics and reporting dashboard is well tailored to our requirements to reach every customer and learn about our campaigns.

Apart from the functionality, the product is easy to use as it is user-friendly. Customer support is very responsive and clarified our concerns at the quickest.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The pricing of the software is a bit on the higher side. Start-ups like our company find it difficult to adopt this. The product is bit complex to implement and set-up at the beginning. Other than that the product is top notch.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solved many problems for our business by providing the one-stop solution for multi-channel marketing. Automating our marketing campaigns by creating workflows. Most importantly the segmentation of the users is bases on their behaviour, and demographics, this could be a major pain point if we had to do it manually. By getting clear segmentation, we could target each segment with specific ads and campaigns.

I use Braze in the day to day functionality of my job in Digital Marketing and I'm looking forward to expanding my skillset to help serve my organisations customers with more personalised and relevant marketing material in the future.

initial_reviews.review_title: Immensely great tool that is a few improvements away from perfection
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I have never worked with another tool that lets you customize the user journey and send campaigns, gather data, and everything else in such high detail. The tools provided within Braze are awesomely useful.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Slow performance and slow loading are the biggest issues I have encountered while working with Braze. They make it quite hard at times to get everything done in one go and it takes a lot more time to wait for Braze to load than to actually do the work.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching out to users in a more custom and personalized way is what I love about Braze the most because it helps us to provide more correct messaging to specific users and therein improve out reachability. Additionally, I love the data that Braze provides both about the users and the performance of the campaigns sent to them.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for unlocking cross-channel CRM activity
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We've been able to create cross-channel CRM activity for the first time, driving incremental uplift compared to our previous technologies, e.g. Abandon Basket. We've seen particular success in our mobile activity as it utilises the Braze SDK and connects into our business ecosystem very neatly. It's allowed our teams to unlock ambitious Use Cases to drive purchase frequency and marketing permissions.

The UI is very intuitive and it's easy for new users to onboard to the platform, plus there's a host of online learning material.

The team is always available, highly responsive and authentic in their culture.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Your data needs to be well organised before it gets into Braze. For us, that means having a CDP to collect and organise data before we send it to Braze This does bring complexity into the stack and needs additional expertise to operate.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Enabling all our CRM channels to trigger off the same data in a unified way - this has consolidated the number of vendors in our business and given our teams the ability to create cross-channel marketing activity

2. Enabling our mobile team to drive App spend and frequency using real-time updates, content and rewards

3. It's forcing a change in our thinking / process to be data-led and customer-led, rather than channel-led

all_reviews.review_title: Irreplaceable MMP that allows our team to provide personalized user experiences w/o devs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We've used Braze for 2+ years and it's unlocked so much for us in terms of being able to provide personalized in app experiences for our users without relying on devs.
- Documentation is always super detailed and helpful
- Constantly improving the platform with new features (they launched AI features like Copy Assistant, image generation, etc. before ChatGPT became the next hot tech)
- They listen to product feedback - we had a use case that required being able to have an array of user attributes and while it took some time, they added the feature into the platform
- Easy to use interface - our marketing team leverages it all the time

What do you dislike about Braze?
There aren't a ton of downsides I can think of. We definitely have some unique use cases in our business that we've had to build workarounds for, but Braze has been great at constantly updating their platform to include new features.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Personalized marketing messages
Sending user the right message at the right time (with intelligent timing)
Automating processes that we previously did manually
Understanding our customer segments better
Being able to push in app messages without engineering support

all_reviews.review_title: Braze has been a game changer for Hayu!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I love that it's user friendly and we're able to implement new features relatively quickly to achieve a personalised, best in class multi-channel CRM journey for our audiences. We use Braze every single day and it's so easy to integrate new things such as catalogs and data fields. I like that our account manager is always on hand to support with any issues and recommend ways we can optimise our campaign or canvas performance.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting side of Braze can be a bit tricky to manage. There are several ways that we can create a report. Some of the quicker report builds have a limit of comparing 5-10 campaigns/canvases at once, which can be a bit frustrating.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is allowing us to maximise the use of our first party data in order to deliver a personalised customer journey to our audiences through the use of liquid script, connected content and catalogs.

all_reviews.review_content:

- it is highly customisable and easy to learn in terms of using the programme
- They provide plenty of easy to access learning material so that their product is easy to use and even value add to it by including industry best practices.
- Their team is always contactable when we require help.
- Data is frequently updated so we can always monitor close to real time performance, allowing us to strategize day to day.

- I wished we could add test contacts that are not part of the existing userbase as we would prefer to test things like EDMs using work emails where if we added accounts it would land in their personal emails.

all_reviews.review_title: Very easy to implement and great features out-of-the-box
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We migrated to Braze in 2023 as we moved away from two legacy systems and consolodated into Braze technology stack. We were able to fully implement into our product in around 3 months across 11 platforms thanks to great documentation and onboarding process.
The features that come out out-of-the-box were easy to integrate into our applications and clearly defined in documentation in terms SDK support.
For anything we have issues or concerns with the customer support team are excellent in coming back swiftly to help troubleshoot and diagnose the issue.
Our CRM team constantly praises the ease of use as something that is intuitive and they very rarely face issue setting up email and in-app messaging campaigns that they set up on a regular basis.
Braze offers some functions that allow customisation through a feature called content cards and we've found great success with this in recent months.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There isn't much to dislike about Braze, however sometimes the support teams can struggle to understand the issue reported if it's specific to product integration. However having a customer support manager allows us to escalate such cases and they can utilise their knowledge of the integration to help speed up support.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Braze to help reach our customers at the right time with the right message to ensure we engage and retain them.
With the help of the plethora of features available and the ability to personalise on scale we have been able to create multiple messaging channels within our apps including bespoke placements.

all_reviews.review_title: I would recommend Braze to someone who is looking for Customer Engagement Platform.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
For me as a person who works more on the setup side, it is easy to integrate Braze into our tech stack, as it offers a wide variety of ways of loading data, be it Snowflake Cloud Data Ingestion, API, or just manual CSV uploads. On top of that, documentation is well-developed and offers pre-made solutions for certain issues that just work. No need to spend time coming up with solutions, when Braze offers one already.
Once the data is loaded, it is very easy to see users and create segments, even if it is just for testing purposes, if the data is successfully loaded. Intuitive UI, especially the new one.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The lack of logs for many processes would be my main issue. When updating data in Braze, it tells you that an error is there, but not information on the details of the error.
Additionally, with the updated UI, daily use-case issues are easier to find, but some niche things have become harder to find and sometimes cause me to switch back to the old UI to observe that.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solves the problem or marketing channel automation, be it SMS, Push Notifications, or Emails. Just keep the data updated and the rest will work well.
It is as strong as your data is and with how easy it is to load new data into Braze, the possibilities are plentiful.

all_reviews.review_title: Great product with some minor limitations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a really easy to use tool and has some great features that can take your marketing to next level! The ease in which you can set up a campaign to multiple channels is great for new comers and experienced marketers alike. It speeds up creating campaigns, tests and optimisation by almost 100%!

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is missing some features that you'd expect from a tool of this size. There are some features that are not editable that I believe should be. The data point restriction can also be a downside as it can become very expensive and with the fixation on data comes more filter  limitations.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is solving our problem of multi-channel marketing. Making it easy for us to talk to customers across more than just email. This will help streamline our marketing.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is a great platform to engage with your customers through many channels
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is very powerful in orchestrating marketing and service messages across different channels such as in-app messages, push notifications, sms, email and web messages. It does not require technical skills to set up a journey which has many decision points. My record of creating a campaign with an audience is within 12 minutes, so you can create a campaign while listening to Ravel's Bolero 

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze data model looks at user level, not at account level. If you want to target an audience that has a specific profile or behaviour within the account (so not attributed to your account contact person, but to the behaviour of the users within that account) then you need to prepare the data more than you would have to do compared to other engagement software. This makes Braze less suitable for B2B corporate use cases.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We inform our customers about our products and services. We stimulate them to use our app more and in the right way. By using a variety of different channels, our reach is great, the response is verty well and the impact is measurable.

all_reviews.review_title: So powerful it's energizing my entire career
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Understanding and enhancing your customer profiles, then acting on that data, is easier in this platform than in any other platform I've worked with. The native functionality with web and apps through SDKs not only enables near real-time data capture, but also powers modern marketing channels - In App, Push, and Content Cards!

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sometimes the email drag and drop creator doesn't meet all of my content creation goals, but I think new features are always improving the platform! Plus, I can download the HTML of blocks that need adjusting and do a blended email with drag+drop and custom HTML to meet those goals.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solves the problem of needing day-to-day developer support to complete marketing initiatives.
Once the Braze SDKs are implemented you can action on all of the rich customer data.

all_reviews.review_title: Multichannel Campaign Capabilities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The main reason for us to drive through Braze was the comprehensive cross-channel personalization ability. They provide multichannel messaging with personalization and cross-channel orchestration capabilities. We are also able to leverage experimentation features frequently while launching brand-new campaigns. It's easy to distribute messages to multiple/desired channels within the same campaign.
I also like the intelligent timing and intelligent channel targeting features. This helps us to optimize when to send a message to a user and through which channel. Both features help us to achieve the user engagement goals with our messaging.
They also improve their product constantly by adding roadmap items coming as requests from their customers. We still have regular check-ins with their team to discuss our additional needs. It's good to see that our requests are being enabled within the product over time.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Complex multichannel campaign management UI caused marketers to have difficulties setting up campaigns and monitoring campaign health through canvasses in the past. Even though canvases look like a perfect solution to manage everything in a user flow, the UI led marketers to ask for engineering help to validate campaign data often. Since the team has been using the product for a long time, we have figured out internal policies to reduce this operational effort, also once people get used to it the additional requests are reduced over time. I think clear guides and comprehensive campaign reporting would help reduce these operational issues.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is powerful in managing campaigns across different channels with comprehensive personalization abilities. We have been using it for the last 2,5 years for cross-channel messaging activities. We started to use it with only D2C email and mobile push messaging, then extended it to B2B messaging and additional channels easily. Because Braze allows us to experiment with new ideas effectively and improve our marketing capabilities with a widely integrated solution.
Even though we have had issues with operational usage along the way and don't find it 100% user-friendly, we could resolve all the problems that led us to choose this product in the first place.

all_reviews.review_title: Bra\e has taken our marketing to a new level
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The customer support and learning academy at Braze is fantastic, our account manager is very helpful and many users of Braze within our team make use of the learning academy to get to grips with the product. Braze also bringing all our customer info into one place to manage those relationships is also very useful and the reporting functionality has helped us get a better understanding of how our marketing is performing

What do you dislike about Braze?
It can be difficult to understand at first and without prior experience with CRM softwares it can be quite confusing which can impact your experience when getting started, however once you get going the tools are very intuiative. It being complicated to use also meant it took a bit longer for us to integrate into our team and can make its implementation into business processes a bit harder particularly when bringing on new users.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze has helped us take our marketing to the next level, whether that be through the use of automation and canvases to help re engage customers or just managing campaigns and reporting on performance. Braze has also helped us understand the effectiveness of marketing even more and allows us to reflect and test easily. The abiltiy to integrate with our internal systems has also been fantastic and has made our overall integration much easier.

all_reviews.review_title: Modern platform for mobile apps and strong professional services
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Robust mix of endpoint APIs, enabling both standalone solutions and complex automations.
Strong professional service team facilitating feature adoption, ticket support, and long-term technical vision and improvements.
Commendable leadership in tech and customer success, bridging the gap between product and CRM.
Strong focus on mobile, offering excellent features for push notifications and email.
Significant improvements in dashboard reporting over the past year, particularly beneficial for brands with limited resources to explore data exporting.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Minimal customization offered by the dashboard and out-of-the-box product and solutions. Addressing specific requirements might take over six months.
Changes related to SCIM endpoints, Global Control Group, or specific endpoints might require months of exploration and decision-making.
Need for more in-product channels and capabilities to reduce the silos between product and CRM and synchronize communications.
Content Cards require further evolution to function more as a real estate placement.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a user, Braze has been instrumental in scaling our lifecycle automation and implementing High-Value Areas (HVAs) strategies. It has enabled us to create sophisticated customer segmentation, leading to more targeted and efficient marketing campaigns. The platform's GenAI feature has been particularly useful in personalizing customer experiences. Additionally, Braze's dynamic content via APIs has allowed us to create more flexible and responsive campaigns. Overall, Braze has significantly enhanced our CRM capabilities.

all_reviews.review_title: Revolutionizing Customer Engagement with Braze!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The best thing that I love about Braze is its multi-channel marketing which allows us to engage with our customers in various channels like e-mails, in-app messages, and push notifications. It has the ability to integrate with third-party tools such as salesforce, and visualization tools makes it more usable. The data analytics and reporting dashboard is well tailored to our requirements to reach every customer and learn about our campaigns.

Apart from the functionality, the product is easy to use as it is user-friendly. Customer support is very responsive and clarified our concerns at the quickest.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The pricing of the software is a bit on the higher side. Start-ups like our company find it difficult to adopt this. The product is bit complex to implement and set-up at the beginning. Other than that the product is top notch.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solved many problems for our business by providing the one-stop solution for multi-channel marketing. Automating our marketing campaigns by creating workflows. Most importantly the segmentation of the users is bases on their behaviour, and demographics, this could be a major pain point if we had to do it manually. By getting clear segmentation, we could target each segment with specific ads and campaigns.

What is great about this however, is that the feedback provided is often integrated and therefore, it never feels like a consistent downside, rather a temporary one.

Its intuatively enhanced the automated user flows of our onbaording liifecyle, as well as increasing engagement and retetention of our subscription based product. Further, with one off campaigns and nuanced segments, Braze has made the mulitude of products we offer more appropriate to certain audiences. Offering the correct customers the right product, reducing CRM pressure while increasing overall conversions and purchases.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
My favorite thing about Braze is robust reporting tools, seamless retargeting capabilities, and an intuitive drag-and-drop email editor. Its reporting tools offer detailed insights into campaign performance, while the retargeting functionality ensures sustained engagement. The user-friendly drag-and-drop editor simplifies email creation, enabling us to craft visually compelling campaigns efficiently.

What do you dislike about Braze?
One drawback of Braze is the limitation in editing campaigns post-launch, especially concerning updating conversion events and action paths within the canvas. Additionally, Braze doesn't scan filters at each step of the canvas. These limitations can hinder the flexibility and real-time optimization potential within ongoing campaigns.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze simplifies the creation of journeys and automated campaigns, streamlining the process for seamless execution. Its user-friendly interface facilitates quicker campaign set-up and management, reducing time spent on manual tasks. Additionally, the platform's enhanced reporting capabilities provide swift insights, enabling faster decision-making and more efficient optimization of marketing strategies.

Its user-friendly interface empowers marketing and product teams to swiftly navigate, enabling them to concentrate on the strategic aspects and outcomes of their programs rather than getting bogged down in technical details. With Braze, you take control of your program, including the setup and data, free from vendor gatekeeping, eliminating the need for external support reliance.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are some minor quality of life issues that concern me, most of them being very subjective though. However the clear roadmap and release schedule shared by Braze, alongside the possibility to raise issues publicly and gain votes to support the importance, truly compensate cfor this.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating custom attribute and custom event-based automations, to support our highly segmented user cohorts across a variety of lifecycle stages.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is hands down the best customer engagement platform on the market!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The most helpful aspect of the Braze platform is it's flexibility. Our team has moved to utilize custom in-app message placements to trigger native experiences to our end users. Braze's documentation and platform provides a robust toolkit at our teams disposal while also providing the opportunity to have deep integrations within our experience.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is a tool with ample documentation and support that allows our team to implement changes with little to no questions. The key area our organization experiences issues/dislike within our use of the tool is customer support in the rare situations it is needed. The customer support process when triaging bugs has been a lengthy process that forces our organization to dedicate additional time/resources rather than receivng clear next steps or potential root causes from the team.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our team utilizes Braze for a number of painpoints within our user journey this includes: monetization, awareness, churn prevention, return engagement. The platform has allowed our team to rapidly test experiences that solve our core problem areas mentioned above at unprecedented rates due to the exclusion of engineering resourcing to execute initiatives and tests.

all_reviews.review_title: Unbeatable Platform for App-First Lifecycle Programs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I have used Braze in a few roles and am a big fan of the platform. It integrates directly with many of the tools we use throughout our stack and if a direct integration isn't available it's typically very easy to integrate via an API, webhook, or Segment.

I really appreciate the app-first approach Braze allows us to take in our lifecycle efforts while still spreading messaging across all channels. The segmentation capabilities are unmatched and the ability to really "choose our own adventure" to fit the platform to our program's needs rather than the other way around is why I'll always push to use Braze over anything else on the market currently.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The need for segment extensions can be frustrating sometimes, especially when we only have a set number of extensions included in our plan.

Customer support has gotten worse over the years, likely as an effort to encourage purchasing a higher tier of support, but that isn't a major blocker most of the time given groups like Email Geeks to help troubleshoot issues while waiting to hear back from the CS team at Braze.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows us to send marketing and transactional messaging across all channels to our users more effectively than when messaging was broken out acorss multiple platforms.

all_reviews.review_title: A great CRM Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I use Braze everyday for my work and I can honestly say it's the best  CRM/Marketing Automation tool I've ever used. I love how Braze makes personalization very easy, it enables so much detail in segmentation. Feels like every scenario campaign is thought about while building the product. Integration can be quite simple if you want it to be. You have a great support team who's there to answer all your questions.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Some small features that exist on other tools like Iterable don't exist in Braze which can be frustrating at times. The documentation can be hard to navigate, is not fully comprehensive of all features, screenshots are from old UXs which can be confusing.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We manage our entire CRM (email communications) from Braze. We migrated from Mailchimp very recently and even in a few weeks we can see how easy it is to use compared to Mailchimp.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze Benefits
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I like the LAB courses and the access you have to the whole team. It's not just your CSM, but access to Product and Engineering as it relates to early access and responding to feedback. On more than one occasion a suggestion I've made has come to life in Braze, and in lots of cases someone from the Product team will schedule a call to walk through an idea or new project. The team at Braze iterates on things quickly and really listen to their customers. They also continue to add useful features that I didn't even think to ask for.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wish there was an easier way to remove contacts that you no longer want to message, and I wish there was a bit more flexibility with targeting options. I also wish in-app messaging was more straightforward in general.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're able to communicate with our users via multiple channels and meet them where they're at. I'm an email marketer by trade, but we've started using push more often as a result of Braze, and in-app messaging is a key channel for us now. Braze has made omni-channel messaging easy. Our next step will likely be SMS.

all_reviews.review_title: Push Notification, In-App, Web Notification, All-In-One
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Design your message once, personalize, and deploy to all channels, or only select channels all in a single campaign. Liquid coding makes personalization very powerful. Relatively short ramp-up period. Deep details on each user's behavior. Love the platform and love the support the team is able to provide. Can't imagine what could be better.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Learning Liquid isn't for everyone, but Braze provides support as needed for the less technical crowd. The Dev environment is sometimes difficult to use when using Dev apps but not used in most cases.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Liquid to highly personalize messages for people who are looking to buy or sell a home based upon their Saved searches and Saved Listings and deliver a specific property link, or a link to specific types of homes that we believe the user is interested in.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is an exceptional platform that's allowed our business to grow and scale.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is excellent for targeting audiences at specific stages of the sales funnel. Our marketing and sales teams use segmentation, personalization, and custom event targeting to reach the appropriate audiences for various campaigns. The teams also use the detailed campaign results to inform future marketing and customer outreach decisions.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze's technical requirements are sometimes challenging to learn as a non-technical professional. API documentation, for example, is easy for developers but difficult for a project manager or marketing manager to understand and implement. Our non-technical team members struggle to communicate project needs and outcomes to developers without understanding the technical requirements to achieve business needs.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a complicated customer onboarding process. We use Braze to track every step of the onboarding process and design outreach communications to iterate on the customer experience. We also use segmentation and custom events targeting to understand our onboarding gaps. We've executed several product changes based on Braze campaign results.

all_reviews.review_title: Enabling Us to Do Everything We Need
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I am a longtime Braze user, and whether it is at my current company, or my past companies, Braze is always my platform of choice when considering platforms to send emails and additional messaging to our users. I love how multichannel compoments are all brought together with Canvas Flow, and how simple it is to send a single-channel message in the Braze Campaigns tab. Although I know much more about Braze than when I started using it 5 years ago, I also can confidently say it is a user-friendly platform that you can onboard into on the easier side (if you take advantage of Braze's LAB - Learning at Braze - trainings).

What do you dislike about Braze?
So far, I've enjoyed everything about working with Braze. It's a platform that I highly recommned to all of my colleagues in the CRM space who are thinking about transitioning toa different platform.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze consistently rolls out new features that meet the ever-growing and changing needs of my team and our customers. For instance, a recent way Braze is solving problems is that they are continuing to iterate towards more AI integrations, which allow our team to test things like testing AI-generated copy and A/B testing this against copy created in-house.

all_reviews.review_title: Outstanding Onboarding and Support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The onboarding process of this platform deserves a standing ovation. It was a breeze to get started, thanks to the step-by-step guides and interactive tutorials. The clear and concise instructions helped me set up my first campaign easily. I also got an additional validation from the Success Team to make sure everything is set up correctly. The platform's thoughtful approach to onboarding made the learning curve virtually non-existent. A key differentiator of this platform is its comprehensive collection of learning resources and trainings. Whether it's video tutorials, written guides, or webinars, there's a wealth of information at your fingertips. These resources not only helped me master the basics but also discover advanced strategies for effective push notification campaigns. It's an ongoing learning experience that empowers users to continually improve their messaging.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There is not much coming to my head about the plaform itself although I didn't like the initial part of Sales process where Data Points weren't explained in clear way and calculated based on the proposed campaigns. It was fixed only by the dedicated Account Executive after signing the contract.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is solving the multifaceted challenges of push notification marketing. It helps me to reach diverse user segments, boost engagement, streamline onboarding, facilitate ad hoc messaging, and also prevent churn. Braze's sophisticated targeting and segmentation capabilities have allowed me to tailor messages to specific user groups, ensuring that each user receives relevant and engaging content. This approach has boosted our reach and ensured that no user is left out of our communication efforts. Its robust features, such as personalized messaging and A/B testing, have enabled me to craft messages that resonate with users. It has allowed me to keep our audience informed and engaged with timely updates, promotions, and announcements.

all_reviews.review_title: A Great Platform With Great Support From Braze
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The drag and drop email build interface provided an easy solution to email builds for a new hire while they would be on their own while the senior members of the team were out on paternity leave. We have since implemented this in place of our existing html build.

What do you dislike about Braze?
No option for video or phone calls with support (zoom or otherwise, scheduled etc.). In the past we've had a breakdown in communication while trying to explain issues over email and screenshots, something which could have been clarified in realtime with screen sharing over zoom. There are some issues with the platform that aren't great, like how product purchase data exists in Braze, tied to user profiles and is usable for segmentation, but not usable with liquid for dynamic personalisation. This has resulted in months of work to create a new attribute to pass data through with an event to essentially store information that is already there in a different way. Braze support were very helpful with getting this to work, but it was a lengthy process and we'll still have to backfill older user's data. I'm sure this will be something they'll enable with an update in the future but it's actually pretty amazing that this isn't available already. It's things like this which on the surface seem like they should be easy to do, that end up being difficult.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows us a central location to handle all of our customer data and in turn use it to send campaigns to those customers. It allows us to send automated campaigns when we need to, and also see the results of those campaigns in real time in a clear and concise way.

all_reviews.review_title: Brilliant platform with great features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
They are always adding new features to the platform and offer training with their in-depth courses and optional exams for certification. I like the ability to enhance the user experience by integrating email, SMS and display content in one place, making Braze a powerful platform. The automated canvases are also easy to use and connect to platforms like Google & Facebook seamlessly.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sending test emails often takes a while to function which if an urgent campaign needs to be sent could impact the business in terms of delivery. The stability of the platform is questionable at times as error page sometimes appears, preventing work from being saved.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze supports campaign delivery whether that be collating the data passed for easy segmentation of audiences, using canvases to create an automated program so campaigns can be created and automatically sent out to consumers 24/7.  The integration with Liquid logic has made personalisation easy and the software that detects 'same account' is also very handy for a clean data.

all_reviews.review_title: A solid option for enterprise-level marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a sold option for marketers looking for a customizable marketing automation platform to slot into the rest of their tech stack. The canvas build is handy, as is the ability to run tests and tag campaigns. It has a healthy ecosystem with other technical solutions. Overall it serves its purpose and has relatively few outages.

What do you dislike about Braze?
A few things I'd change: search functionality is tiresome (no fuzzy matching and no smart search algorithms); not being able to copy canvas steps from one canvas to another; and the updated user interface for the all-up canvas view is so incredibly unhelpful (especially compared to the previous view which you can no longer utilize). If you use communication engagement metrics as your primary conversion metric, then the reporting might work fine for you. Using custom events as your primary conversion metric unfortunately also means not being able to trust/use Braze's built-in reporting tools, which is too bad. Lastly, I've  had severe and repeated issues with a Braze/Branch integration, and neither company has been willing to take responsibility or actually fix it--so if you are going to go with Braze, I recommend NOT going with Branch.io as your deep link and link tracking platform.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze helps us market to our entire known market.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool to build communications at scale
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze integrates well with our company's tech stach. I particularly enjoy the user interface, the multichannel possibilities and how easy it is to build personalised communications. However, the biggest advantage we get from Braze is how easy it is to build communications at scale. Features like Catalogs or its integration with Lokalise really help us sending relevant communications across 11 different languages and markets.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The main challenge I faced with Braze is not having a Drag&Drop editor available for basic features such as the dynamic email footer or the 'unsubscribe' landing page. These can only be created with HTML as of today and it looks like the BRaze Product team hasn't brought all the capabilities they have in communications creation (ie: email, push notifications) to all the areas of their product.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is very helpful when it comes to creating personalised communications at scale. We are able to send the same email across 11 different languages and several markets by creating one single template. This saves a lot of time when building automations across all our markets and it makes us way more flexible when it comes to A/B testing and tracking the uplift our marketing communications generate.

all_reviews.review_title: User-friendly / full functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
My company and I use Braze for push notifications on all our apps. It is user-friendly, with every functionality available in the right places. It is the only destination for our in-app/push notification practices. With a company that is all about security, Braze offers advanced security for the data, with easy implementation and integration on all our apps. It also offers multi-channel campaigns with many features.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting aspect could be improved, filtering, etc. as well as the documentation for advanced features.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solves the ability to automate, send, or schedule in-app/push notifications/content cards for mobile and desktop apps. It is benefiting my team by allowing us to act on triggers, with full personalization.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I love using Braze to send emails to large groups. It has great templates and is a relatively easy system to learn - I still consider myself a beginner and haven't taken advantage of certain things like canvases and audience segmentation.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I think there are some parts of Braze where the lack of analytics for certain aspects of what I am searching for is slightly weird because they seem realy simple. For example, I was trying to look at the heat map of one variant of email we sent and it would not do so for CTAs that are email popups.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We want to send mass emails to large groups of users while also making them aesthetically pleasing and according to our brand guidelines. I think Braze has great analytics overall and is a pretty intuitive platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Wouldn't use anything else. Best customer engagement platform available.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
- Class-leading personalisation and segmentation. This is where it shines. If you can think of it, Braze can probably target it.
- Easy to use and comes with intuitive features, as well as Drag and Drop Editors
- But you can do full custom code as well
- Canvases can be complex and personalised but the Canvas Flow makes them so easy to build
- Experimentation, A/B test and machine learning options are next level

What do you dislike about Braze?
- Not having auto-save when building messages. You need to hit save draft quite often to be careful
- Has good testing options but sometimes it can be tricky to get test messages to surface

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us raise our MAU. It lets us easily target users where they are, whether it be externally or inside the product, and we can do so based on their actions. We also use it to spin up temporary product surveys or MVPs for testing that will later be hard coded.

all_reviews.review_title: Modern, User-Friendly system.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The system is very user friendly. I can easily self service on the platform and get answers to what I need. The Customer Service is also great. My partners are very responsive and attentive to my needs. Overall it's one of the strongest ESPs I've seen.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The campaigns and customer journey (Canvas) sections cannot be looked at together in reporting or on a calendar. When I'm building out smaller customer journeys in canvas, they don't appear in a calendar-like setting, so it's a bit of an inconvenience to have to merge reports. However, when looking at the package in totality, their benefits far outweigh this small con.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
They are helping us communicate with our Customers through the right channels and providing innovative tools to help us achieve that through personalization. We are seeing engagement metrics that we wouldn't have sight into otherwise. What most impresses me about Braze is that they proactively inform us of new industry trends and features.

all_reviews.review_title: We have been with Braze for a while now - An effective engagement platform with some drawbacks
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Great segmentation and targeting, popular enought to integrate with most major platforms, constatnly improving and adding features, strong automated (canvas) campaigns, relatively quick ticket support that is able to answer most technical questions, strong technical documentation, strong app-related messaging/engagement tools

What do you dislike about Braze?
Difficut identity resolution,  integration requires technical resources (more advanced integration), SMS sending is good but fairly basic SMS tools and integrations, added costs for most features (negotiate at the start for all the features you need)

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
A single platform for customer engagement that provides both single send (campaign) and automated send (canvas). Strong API means it can be customized and integrated into many systems.

Braze offers a lot of personalization and is great if your business doesn't use something like Shopify.

It can be difficult to transition over to Braze from other platforms fully. For our business, it is a lengthy process and cannot be done without the help of developers. There's also lot of limitations around reporting and how the campaigns are built; it's not quite as in-depth or user-friendly as other platforms.

Braze helps us communicate with our customers in a highly segmented way.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is one of the
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The upsides of using Braze are plenty.  The navigation is easy to use and friendly to work around. As a web-based platform, it's easy to access the account from any laptop without installing software. You can create a detailed multichannel journey within minutes!

What do you dislike about Braze?
- Could have more potential for data inspection, currently this is lacking at a software level
- Need some development in loading speed in general. It can sometimes be slow, but it has improved from before.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Helping to build an automated customer journey by just adding a few steps
- Able to create detailed segments and understand customer profile and their personal data, which can be used to develop targeted/bespoke campaigns
- Working with clients who use different channels such as: push, email or in-app and Braze makes it easy to create any campaigns easily.
- One of the biggest problems is ease of use. A lot of new/beginners that use CRM feel daunted or find it difficult to learn and adapt, through Braze's learning path and easy user interface, using it seems less daunting.

all_reviews.review_title: The standard for app-based businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
There's really no other platform out there that can do everything Braze can do. It's by far the best marketing automation solution for app-based companies. The platform is very powerful and feature-rich - easy for both marketers and engineers to work with. Support is also pretty good.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Some annoying things about the UI/UX - load times on complex canvases can be very slow. No auto-save feature when you're working on campaigns.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Communicating and nurturing new contacts; gives us lots of ability to send messages based on user actions within the app.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to learn, but data gathering could be more user-friendly
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Easy to use. Simple e-blasts are easy to set up and update. Drag and drop system works well with graphics and videos. Multiple templates readily available, but you also have the option to start from scratch.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Using segments can be complicated when multiple updates are required.
Finding data can be difficult, but this might be a specific problem for my team.
Having to save through multiple screens is a good idea...but maybe having a notification when you try to exit before saving could be useful, instead of just losing all your work because of the missed save button.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating our e-blasts and scheduling its delivery. Helps us plan ahead of time and more efficiently.

all_reviews.review_title: Stay ahead of the curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I recently had the pleasure of using Braze, and I must say that I am thoroughly impressed with the platform's capabilities. The features provided by Braze allowed us to gain a deep understanding of our customers' preferences and behaviors across multiple digital touchpoints, which enabled us to send personalized and relevant messages to each customer in real-time.

One of the things that stood out to me about Braze was its ability to classify audiences and orchestrate campaigns seamlessly. The platform made it incredibly easy to test and iterate on our campaigns, ensuring that we were sending the right message, on the right channel, and at the right time.

This has been especially helpful for us as we continue to scale during this high-growth phase of our company journey.

Overall, I would highly recommend Braze to any company looking to streamline their customer engagement efforts and deliver personalized and relevant messaging to their customers. The platform's continuous evolution and addition of new products and features only add to its value, making it a must-have tool for any company looking to stay ahead of the curve in today's fast-paced digital landscape.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is a complex platform with a steep learning curve.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform's real-time data classification and audience targeting capabilities were particularly impressive, as it made it easy to segment our customers based on their interests and engage with them in a more targeted way. This resulted in higher engagement rates and ultimately, better ROI on our campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Recent enhancements are in the right direction
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is easy to use for any marketer at any technical skill level. It has many out-of-the-box features related to mobile app integration. A few recent enhancements make Braze even better: Canvas version history, new navigation and query builder.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Having the dashboard for each canvas and campaign is helpful, but it would be nice if a user could view statistics based on individual runs in a canvas (rather than just cumulative.) It would also be nice if there were a way to insert global elements into email templates that could be updated at once (i.e. ability to have a global footer that, if edited in the library, would be updated in every template it was used in simultaneously.)

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allowing us to execute multiple versions of campaigns in a single canvas.

all_reviews.review_title: One Stop Marketing Platform Braze allows for all Marketing to be done in the same place.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze allows for all Marketing to be done in the same place using many touch points, including Email, SMS, Push, and in app Content Cards & Newsfeeds. The Canvases and Campaigns available will allow any user to create the right path for every type of customer. The segmenting feature is critical in pinpointing the ideal customer to receive the correct Marketing content. The Braze Learning and Documentation in Resources is crucial to supporting the creation of campaigns and troubleshooting issues. Lastly, the speed of Braze Support response after ticket submission allows the team to quickly resolve issues so we never miss an opportunity to engage with our customers.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The Canvas view made adjusting the many steps in a canvas slightly complicated. Thankfully, Braze has now migrated over to Canvas Flow tool, which simplifies the entire Canvas creation process.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze positions itself to ingest all pertinent customer data (attributes, demographics, etc.)  that is then easily accessible to be used to target customer segments. By having all customer data in a centralized place, it allows for quick campaign and canvas setup. Additionally, the metrics and statistics readily available for all customer communications make identifying issues quick.

all_reviews.review_title: Adaptable tools with great ongoing support and a strong future
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze covers a variety of messaging channels with straightforward interfaces and common triggers/interactions, making it perfect for modern holistic messaging. Once you understand how to interact in the system as intended and leverage the various events and attributes at your disposal, many fascinating options open up for you as "free" benefits of your implementation. On the human level, we were connected early on with an outstanding Customer Success Manager and an excellent account executive, both of whom have been highly communicative and proactive with getting our people trained and evangelizing best practices internally.

What do you dislike about Braze?
As a developer, I find the Liquid support for complex personalization very handy, but the documentation could be more consistent/current, and the examples better tested. If you go in expecting message bodies to serve solely as the templating/presentation layer and able to work with that constraint, you'll do well, but if you start wanting to put complex logic in your templates, your life rapidly gets difficult.
To a degree, this is a question of clashing paradigms more than a flaw in Braze, but it's tantalizing to have so much power in the template/message level and suddenly hit a brick wall when you take that one step too far. As with most templating languages, the error tracing/debugging is minimal to nonexistent -- designing things to "fail silently" when issues are encountered, while best for "live" messaging, can be problematic for those of us trying to figure out where issues originate.
We have encountered some other speedbumps with Braze, but this is one of the few that wasn't being specifically addressed in ongoing improvements or for which an alternate solution was available.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us modernize and streamline communications with our users. We can now convert what were once complex email and SMS experiences, previously orchestrated across multiple vendors and internal databases, into a form that allows us to offload tremendous amounts of data manipulation and retention to Braze's systems. Further, doing so means we can give the experiences a cohesive management system at the same time, and every additional data point offloaded broadens our options for messaging. Braze enabled us to branch into mobile notifications easily, and soon we're hoping to integrate site experiences as well, allowing us to reach our users in a more adaptable, holistic fashion without having to do all the heavy lifting ourselves via internal systems.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is the Benz in the Biz.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
How clean and user-friendly it is. The dashboard is easy to navigate and you can get to various sections in one or two clicks.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting is at its best, mediocre. While we are able to gather metrics around campaign performance, pulling numbers from Canvases that contain multiple variants or types of communications can take some time. You're not really able to get insights from your actual users. If you want to know what day of the week or time of day that users are most engaging, you have to do that via your own data warehouse, which I get but things of that nature are still limited.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problems that Braze is solving is that there are various bells and whistles that make using it super easy. There are things like intelligent delivery, which is helpful if you have time to use it. The AB testing capabilities have improved drastically and you can basically set it and forget it if you have enough data or users. Additionally, the drag and drop editor is helpful should you ever have issues with coding, you can makeshift a template.
