all_reviews.review_title: Very easy to use and whenever you're having a problem the Braze team is very helpful and efficient.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The customization, usability, and reporting. After a few uses, Braze becomes very easy to use and navigate. If I ever stop using Braze, Braze will definitely be the standard for customer engagement platforms. Wow, sounds like I'm dating Braze. Anyways, love Braze.

I would like to also mention that the Braze Customer Service team is top-notch. If you have a problem, you're guaranteed to get a fast response back.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I really enjoy Braze. No significant dislikes come to mind. All previous dislikes have been addressed by product features and developments.

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
Definitely experiment with all the available features Braze has to offer, don't be afraid to contact support, and use Stripo for email creation.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problems: Engagement (Email, Push, In-App Messages), Reporting, User Information.

We can use Braze to see info on our users, send unique engagement messages to them, and then see the data through reporting to make better-optimized decisions in the future.

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive, Simple Software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I've used Marketo, MailChimp, Constant Contact, and Hubspot amongst others. Braze thus far, has been my favorite platform. It offers customization levels similar to Marketo, while offering a much more user-friendly interface. The canvas feature is so easy to use and gives you that global view needed to review!

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are some design limitations. I'd love to be able to design mobile emails completely separate from desktop for some emails. The coding requiring to feed all the data we need in has been a challenge for us. Capacity on our dev team is limited, which pushes data integration back with Braze.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are working on automated flows like welcome series, abandon-cart, win-back, and nurture campaigns. These were not something we could do intuitively and track before using Braze.

all_reviews.review_title: One of the best all around marketing automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
One of the best in the category after working on other platforms such as Hubspot, Pardot, IBM Marketing Cloud, and Mailchimp. Oracle Responsys

Straightforward and intuitive UI

Excellent ability to create segments and filters, combine them and use them for sending lists, filters or triggers

Many advanced scheduling and AB testing options

Easy to use journey editor

Works with liquid programming language

Ability to create Braze-to-Braze API calls that update segments, create custom events and allow a lot of flexibility based on the existing custom fields without a need for a business analyst or a front-end coder

What do you dislike about Braze?
The IDE experience lacks more specific errors notification and  logging

The canvas experience can improve its overall conversion dashboard since canvas doesn't have a delay function as campaigns; you let users enter and start the flow only after a time delay. But they are counted for the conversion, although they didn't go through the flow

Braze-to-Braze API should become more simplified and productized. Currently, "update contact" on the canvas is only allowing to update of custom fields and not default fields or allow simple calculations

The reporting tool can allow more segmentation and filtering, display over time

Everything else is damn good

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ability to work efficiently with custom events as triggers, calculate them and act upon their data payload in a very useful way.
It is the fastest and easiest I have seen.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze offers a straight-forward, dynamic customer engagement tool.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is extremely easy to use! It only took our team about 1-2 months to transfer all of our old email campaigns and other customer communications into Braze. I was initially nervous to make the switch, being attached to our old tools. But Braze's learning modules and their team made it easy!

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wish that creating Segments/Lists were easier. For some reason I feel that creating Segments in Braze is not as straightforward for me as it has been with other platforms. I simply like to upload external lists like CSV files and go from there.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us communicate with our customers regularly and in a personalized fashion via multiple channels including email, SMS, push notifications, in-app messages, and more! Creating a Canvas/Campaign in Braze is extremely straightforward, and we feel confident that we could easily train any of our future staff members to use the platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Reliable and Scalable solution for businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
- Easy to integrate with Snowflake data warehouse.
- Robust segmentation capabilities.
- Comprehensive A/B Testing tools.
- Dynamic ways to create journeys that integrate various messaging channels.
- Very responsible customer support.
- User-friendly interface that it's relatively easy to navigate.
- Accesible resources to assist users in learning the platform.

What do you dislike about Braze?
- Poor dark more support.
- No a lot of tools to research SMS rejections issues or emails delivery issues on my own.
- Pricing is a higher than other CRMs in the market.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Campaigns are easy to scale, robust segmentations capabilities, easy to personalized messaging, reporting, easy to sync with Snowflake.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is my favorite platform to work with retention and egagement strategies
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a very intuitive platform to work with cross-channel strategies. Being able to use attributes and events on the same strategy and all channels makes it easy to orquestrate messages and impacts according to user's actions and interests on our website and app. Also, Intelligent Timming and Intelligent Channel are some great features to get the best performance within our campains.  Along with our CS, learning paths and the bonfire community is a huge ally to experiment new things in a short time.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is amazing for retention/engament purpuses, but on the hand can lack a lot of features for lead capturing with qualification and nurturing according to users behaviour with outsite contents. Also, not having a automatic saving of campaigns and canvases can lead to work loss if you deal with internet issues.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Link aliasing is a feature we're looking forward to use a lot to qualify users interest based on our welcome campaigns and to retarget active clients.
Canvas Flow also allows us to save new information into the users profiles according to an action which will be very helpfull to us.

all_reviews.review_title: The Premier Customer Engagement Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a superior tool and company to other competitors in the market. Braze's feature set and capabilities are more advanced and are constantly being iterated upon and improved. The company also offers a wealth of knowledge on how to use the tool and recommends best practices to advance your business. Their onboarding team held our hands through the implementation process to help us ramp up quickly, and their customer support is highly responsive.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wish you could build campaigns in a dev environment and automatically ship them to prod. I also wish for email that you could click done and it would save as draft vs. having to click done and wait to click save as draft after it finishes saving. Our designers forget to save their work a lot because of that extra step.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is allowing us to message customers in an automated way across multiple channels - many of which Braze unlocked for the first time. By using real-time data to trigger and personalzie messages for customers, we're delivering a quality experience for our users that we couldn't before implementing with Braze.

all_reviews.review_title: Great multi-channel tool for Marketing Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is quite user-friendly and it offers really nice options for setting up campaigns with multi-channel approach (including App messaging, Email and others like SMS, Social Media Channels etc.). The tool clearly offers a good view on User behavior across different channels and provides many options to customize the tool and perfectly adapt it to individual Use Cases.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The consumption of Data Points have to get monitored closely and some parts could be easier to handle like Webhooks, Personalization and string operators within Segmentation. But there are plenty ways to educate yourself (various Learning paths, which makes it easy to learn).

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
There are many functionalities in Braze. Switching tools is not needed that often and jumping from tool to tool usually makes daily work less effective. Besides this, I like tagging all the assets which provides a better view. We don't have to work with folders and spend less time searching for specific items.

all_reviews.review_title: An easy-to-use platform with great customer support!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze makes it easy for our team to create seamless user experiences across multiple channels in one easy-to-use interface. The platform is intuitive, and the ability to target users on a granular level has allowed us to create personalized experiences, increase engagement, better predict revenue, and reduce churn overall. Braze also offers fantastic customer support - whether it's working through a complex use-case, getting set up on a new channel, or a technical problem, the Braze team is always quick to respond and make time to provide support and it's very much appreciated (special shoutout to Melissa!). Braze has significantly helped us scale our marketing efforts, and I highly recommend it!

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze offers a ton of functionality in terms of liquid language and personalization, but with limited HTML code knowledge, it can sometimes be hard to implement some of the use cases and functionalities we'd like to leverage (also learning on our part that needs to be done!). Small tweaks throughout the platform would improve our team's efficiency and workflows, like the ability to edit multiple emails simultaneously rather than toggling back and forth but overall very happy with the platform.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Braze, we can reach our audience where they are most likely to engage and easily implement an omni-channel marketing strategy from one centralized solution. With its ability to process consumer data in real-time, we can deliver personalized messages when they matter most, resulting in high-value actions for our business.

all_reviews.review_title: Awesome tool for automating customer interaction - eg in tourism
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We are using braze to enable Destinations in creating personalized, helpful communication along their whole customer journey. We are also leveraging braze for interaction with our Skiline Community of Skiers and Snowboardes (5Mio users). Braze handles massive communication easily, has lots of functionality through APIs but also through the UI itself to segment and personalize messages on different media.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Getting data out of braze - e.g. information of a user, can be a bit tricky. Braze is not a CRM but shares some of the functionality, therefore sometimes functionalities overlap and it needs planning which the leading system is. Some limitations if you need information across app groups which is currently not possible.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze enables us to have personalized communication accross the whole customer journey for our destinations (tourism) - from the booking phase, to prestay, to being on site and enjoying the holiday and after the stay.

all_reviews.review_title: A Promising Platform with Room for Improvement
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We were able to shoot for many different platforms in one place and that's great.

The interface has improved with the last update and it is also a positive point that deserves to be highlighted.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is extremely slow, either to load the bases or to load the interfaces, which is understandable given the amount of data we already have inside it, but it's frustrating all the waiting time.

And despite the latest update that improves the situation, the platform is still very confusing, unintuitive and even evasive, showing notifications about what everyone is doing to everyone else.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us with all the triggers of the research we carry out, fulfills its role, and requires patience. We often need to adapt to our reality, but it works ok.

all_reviews.review_title: A Powerful and User-Friendly Tool with Exceptional Support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
One of the best aspects of Braze is its user-friendly interface and intuitive canvas-building feature. The platform is very easy to navigate and allows users to easily build (complicated) flows between messages through its straightforward drag-and-drop way of working. In particular, Braze's latest shift towards "Canvas Flow" has made building campaigns feel even more intuitive and efficient.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Initially, my main complaint with Braze would've been the lack of customization options for in-app messages. However, they are currently rolling out a new drag-and-drop editor for in-app messages, which is looking very promising so that should improve that feature. Another potential downside is that email seems like an expensive channel to maintain, although I don't have any direct comparison to other platforms in terms of pricing.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us to effectively communicate with our riders through various channels, including email, in-app messaging, and push notifications. This has allowed us to improve our lifecycle campaigns, target specific groups of riders with personalized messaging, and increase rider engagement. Additionally, Braze's user-friendly interface and intuitive canvas building make it easy for us to create and manage complex campaigns. Overall, Braze is helping us to improve the rider experience and drive positive results for our business.

What is more, the customer service and resources available to learn are very helpful. I also enjoy that they are constantly looking to improve and add new features. Even our product team has adopted Braze and is happy to help us integrate new Braze features so that we can make the most of it.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting could be improved as sometimes it's not easy to get the numbers that you would like to, although I know that they are working on it and improvements are on the way. There are more details I could mention, as I've been using the platform for many years. But I greatly appreciate their efforts to improve constantly, especially in the last couple of years.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Braze for our CRM strategy but not only. We also use it for customer surveys and sometimes to test new potential product features before developing them on our app. It's a crucial tool to improve our business metrics.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to get started, helpful support, and robust CRM functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
CRM tools can be challenging to launch for SMBs, but Braze makes it as easy as possible. The options and encouragement to segment users really drives campaign success. However, the best part of Braze is not the tool itself -- but their customer support. When I'm facing a technical or analytical issue, Braze's support representatives consistently feel like an extension of my team. I can get a response at any time of the day and know in confidence that their expertise will solve my problem.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze has all the core functionality you need. I'd love to see more options to organize campaigns in the dashboard as well as an easy way to transfer campaigns between apps.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us reach our audience through in-app content and off-app push notifications, creating a full-cycle marketing funnel to retain our users and increase brand awareness.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is a robust, intuitive, and ever improving CRM powerhouse.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I was new to CRM when I started 3 years ago, and I'm glad to have started with Braze. It was easy to pick up yet sophisticated. Robust without being daunting. It's also ever-evolving. The Braze team is very open and welcoming to critiques and improvements. If there is some feature you can dream of, the Braze team is either already working on it, or will give it to their team. This makes it so you're never quite a master, because there are always new features to learn about and use.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sometimes you need to do workarounds for simple things, such as if you want to deploy a communication at the end of every month, there's no easy way to do that. You can deploy on that same day once a month, but since months change amount of days, it's not ideal.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
In my old position, we needed event properties to persist through an entire canvas journey. After the first step. They just disappeared, meaning we had to use web hooks to turn those event properties into custom attributes, which costed us data points. Braze came out with both User Update (creating custom attributes without a data point cost) and persistent event properties around the same time, offering us two solutions for our problem, saving the company time and money and headache.

all_reviews.review_title: The best CRM tool I have ever worked with!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I really appreciate the range of marketing automation tools that Braze offers. The ability to segment and target our audience based on their behaviors and attributes has been particularly useful for us. We've also seen great success with personalized email campaigns and in-app messaging. Overall, Braze has helped us increase our customer engagement and retention rates. In terms of comparing it to other platforms, I would say Braze has a pretty intuitive and user-friendly interface, which has made it easy for our team to get up and running with it quickly. There have been a few minor hiccups along the way, but the Braze support team has always been quick to help us resolve any issues.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I would love it if Braze could provide a bit more flexibility in terms of analytics. It would be great if Braze had more robust integration options to allow for a more seamless workflow. That said, I have provided this feedback to the Braze team, who have indicated that they are improving their integration capabilities. Regarding other features, I would love to see more advanced A/B testing options within the platform. Overall, I think Braze is a robust platform, but like any tool, there is always room for improvement.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is a customer engagement platform that is continually evolving and improving its services to meet the needs of businesses. Over the past few years, the company has made significant strides in expanding and enhancing its features and functionality, and it is clear that Braze is committed to helping businesses succeed through effective CRM tactics and strategies. The company has a strong track record of listening to customer feedback and implementing changes and updates based on this feedback, which is a testament to its dedication to meeting the needs of its users. I'm excited to see what Braze has in store for the future and how it will continue to help businesses achieve their goals through its innovative platform.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Connection using liquid logic and catalogs to a CMS for localisation purposes. Also, randomisation within a canvas to get a fast read on step performance is tricky. Finally, when a live Canvas has a draft saved, if the live canvas is stopped, the draft is deleted..

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is a very complete tool, but it is complex in almost all aspects, where we need a lot of technical help, which delays the process. Even with a 24h SLA, the answers are not always with solutions, but sending different materials to resolve, and the technical part of our team ends up working more in the error/correct attempt.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us communicate with Pizza Hut's end customers. We are developing new segmentations and designing a new consumer journey to improve performance and increase the engaged base.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze has completely leveled up our marketing!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Where to begin! First, Braze makes it easy for a small + nimble email/lifecycle team to work efficiently. The general ease of the platform and interface is a breath of fresh air. Second, Braze easily organizes customer data in a way that makes it easy to segment and target. Additionally, I love how Braze allows us to truly think cross channel and figure out the best way to communicate with our customers. Lastly, Braze's customer support is INCREDIBLE, from our AM + CSM to the support team available for ticket help - everyone has made our transition successful.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There were times during our onboarding/integration that I felt we could have used a little more handholding. I (as a marketing lead) oversaw the entire integration, including on the tech side, so there were some areas there where more guidance from Braze would have been hepful.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is allowing us to segment our customers based on data we have about them in our database and trust this data. A big issue with our previous ESP was data integrity. Braze's onboarding process ensured our data was accurate.

all_reviews.review_title: 5* CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We recently switched to Braze (from CleverTap) as our CRM platform, and we are incredibly impressed with its capabilities thus far. The dashboard is user-friendly and intuitive, making it easy for the team to quickly get up to speed on how to use the platform.

One of the standout features of Braze is its robust customer segmentation capabilities. It allows us to easily create targeted campaigns and personalise messaging, which has helped us to engage effectively with our customers.

In addition to its robust functionalities, Braze also has excellent customer support. Whenever we have had a question or encountered an issue, the support team has been quick to respond and has always been able to help resolve it. The service provided by the Customer Success Team is second to none - Mark and Chloe couldn't be better!

Overall, we are delighted with Braze as our new CRM platform and would highly recommend it to other businesses looking to improve their customer engagement and marketing.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Thus far, we have not had any issues with the platform - There has been minimal downtown or complications compared to our previous platform which continuously caused problems.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze helps us connect and personalise our content to our database with a simple and effective platform that allows us to get campaigns at speed helping us drive revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: For an Intuitive and Mostly Seamless Experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The best thing about Braze is how easy it is to create campaigns and canvases! Building a workflow has never been so easy! Even using HTML code or building emails without HTML code is pretty seamless.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Occasionally I will run across situations with emails that are hard to resolve with limited HTML code knowledge. It is not often a bad experience, in fact more often than not, it is a seamless experience. User imports can sometimes be tricky if you only have an email for the member.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
I love that Braze recently came up with the ability to view emails in dark mode. I additionally love the exit canvas option, so no matter where a member is in the canvas if a specific event occurs, it will kick them out of the canvas. There is less of a concern of members writing in asking why they received an automated message.

Additionally, in our company we desperately needed the ability to send automated messages through the customer's journey and Braze really helps resolve that without needing a lot of engineers and extra developers.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I love Braze's user-friendly features. Braze is easy to use, and I can do so much within there for someone who is not typically technical or heavily operational in skillset. I like that we can segment various campaigns in order to meet our customers where they need to be met using a modality of channels, but all within the same canvas. I love that Braze and their team members are always available to help us and make sure we have the support we need to accomplish our goals. On top of our monthly meetings, we can always submit support questions or issues we face and get quick, prompt responses to help us.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wish there were more reporting capabilities and an easier way to drive data within the platform. Sometimes I feel that I need to be better connected from a data standpoint to understand our campaign performance truly. Maybe if we had a better integration with out analytics team here, and had the necessary data I would feel differently, which I don't necessarily think is Braze's fault, but maybe we can partner better to identify solutions. I also wish we could better optimize customer's profiles and integrate additional channels like telephonic outreach as well as direct mail.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is making our marketing automation possible and solving so much manual work on our end in order to take our users down a personalized journey. Braze is also a one-stop shop for all things marketing automation due to their extensive list of technology partners.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze helps us on a daily basis to organise and improve our CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is easy to use and offers a wide range of possibilities. Additionally through automations it makes it easy to run experiments and tests. In addition Braze support as well as our key account manager and technical support manager are super fast in responding to all our questions.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are some technical issues here and there, which aren't fixed as fast as we would like to have it. Some areas of improvement are not tackled at the moment like having the possiblitily to set up a Control group for multichannel campaigns, especially when the two channels in a campaign are iOS and android, which would prevent you from setting up two campaigns for each platform separately.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze offers a all-in-one solution to do CRM smoothly and in an automated way, which benefits our users immensely in getting all the info they require to make an informed decision.

all_reviews.review_title: Not a smooth ride
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The end-result looks good. Customization options. Many learning resources. Easy to test and edit campaigns.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Implementation is time consuming and arduous, with many technical difficulties. We're ping-ponging back and forth a lot, and we don't feel fully supported by Braze staff who don't seem to be as concerned that the product isn't working even after months of implementation. It takes a lot more dev resources than it should. Complex usability, and nothing is out of the box. It takes a lot of effort to understand and learn Braze, even outside of the Dev team and to me it shouldn't be this complicated to create in-app messaging.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Providing in-app guidance and information for customers. Notifications about product changes and creating product and usability awareness.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy transition and great experience with Braze!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
My favorite thing about Braze is its empowerment of all team members to run a campaign from start to end. It is easy and intuitive to build audiences, pull code blocks and templates, and even preview test devices in the platform to ensure no breaks are occurring.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Coming from SFMC, I wouldn't say I like Braze's lack of an auto-save feature. A few times, I have forgotten to save a work in progress, only to find that the tab or browser has accidentally been exited and all work has been lost.

It would be great to have a toggle feature where the user could choose whether they want auto-save functionality.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Personally, Braze is helping to solve my lack of expertise in building queries by creating an easy-to-use audience builder. I can independently make audience segments based on personalized customer attributes and preferences while ensuring all necessary exclusions are in place.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer: My favorite thing about Braze is its empowerment of all team members to run a campaign from start to end. It is easy and intuitive to build audiences, pull code blocks and templates, and even preview test devices in the platform to ensure no breaks are occurring.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer:
Coming from SFMC, I wouldn't say I like Braze's lack of an auto-save feature. A few times, I have forgotten to save a work in progress, only to find that the tab or browser has accidentally been exited and all work has been lost.

It would be great to have a toggle feature where the user could choose whether they want auto-save functionality.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Personally, Braze is helping to solve my lack of expertise in building queries by creating an easy-to-use audience builder. I can independently make audience segments based on personalized customer attributes and preferences while ensuring all necessary exclusions are in place.

all_reviews.review_title: Extremely good marketing automation software and great customer service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I like all the marketing automation capabilities and how reliable it is. I also like how quickly Braze basically pays for itself through incremental sales.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I think the biggest risk with regards to braze is that it has competitors that are rolling out more and more features at a faster pace.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is solving our need to segment and personalize our CRM with our customers. It allows for seamless journey orchestration that provides for incremental sales. Its email, push, and in-app capabilities are robust, and its breadth of integrations is top-notch.

Using liquid to personalize customer communications is a powerful capability if used correctly.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is an amazing tool with great capabilities that makes multichannel marketing easier.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
All the features and steps to create a campaign or canvas are pretty intuitive, making it easy. It is relatively easy to develop and edit creativities for communications and new segmentations.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I believe braze is like the brain, we only unleash 10% of its power, there should be more material and videos to learn about the tool's capabilities. You need to constantly check if your events and attributes work as the tool is unaware if they are working correctly. And finally (I don't know if it's the fault of the tool itself), but sometimes during the day, it is impossible to work with it as nothing loads. It is straightforward to duplicate canvases and create new ones, but you cannot delete them, only archive them, making them endless.

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
The tool is excellent!

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
I believe it is the best tool for a CRM to place its budget efficiently to a particular target group thanks to the info the tool gathers and its segmentation capabilities. In addition, the communication channels are great and easy to use.

all_reviews.review_title: Very easy to use!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is very easy to use. I'm a new user, and it's been relatively easy to navigate the platform and set up campaigns. I really like being able to limit how many contacts receive a campaign, a feature that has been handy during the IP warmup process and for surveys. The calendar view for campaigns is also very convenient for helping me visualize my campaign schedule.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wish it were possible to segment out soft bounces so that I can suppress them from receiving future campaigns. I also wish there was an easy way to dedupe contacts that have both an external id and user alias.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us automate a portion of our email marketing and easily launch our monthly campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze should definitely be the Campaign Management Tool in your MarTech stack
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Compared to other marketing automation tools in the market, Braze has one of the most intuitive, user-friendly interface which makes building a complex customer journey easy. While it takes some time to understand the documentation, the use cases are generally clear and easy to follow.

The biggest shoutout to the success of using Braze attributes to the amazing onboarding and customer success team members who have been instrumental in providing training and guidance steps, which are both critical to the adoption of the platform at an Enterprise level in less than 6 months!

What do you dislike about Braze?
There is a learning curve to using Braze, and as with all platforms, it is not easy to drive it forward in the beginning. An example would be the understanding of using Liquid to harass the full capability of personalization in Braze, but for an uninitiated marketer, that would be a very daunting step to overcome. While there are different ways to configure a setup in Braze, the more elegant approach or solution would usually require some development help or technical support (e.g building of APIs or data ETLs) which might not be at the disposal of every marketing team.

That said, there are still good low-lift solutions which are native to Braze and could be implemented with the support of Braze onboarding and the customer success team. I would strongly recommend it due to their high level of commitment to success.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is an all-in-one customer engagement tool which allows the team to effortlessly orchestrate multi-marketing channels (i.e. Email, SMS, IAM, Push notifications) in a single customer journey view and the ability to scale up with different experimentations designs using drag-and-drop features. Implementing Braze SDK (by collecting data points) into our mobile app/website has also enabled us to transit from the current tactical campaigns to building more data-driven, customer-centric customer lifecycle campaigns. Another big plus of using Braze is how the platform ingests data that allows content personalization on the fly (via APIs) that supercharges our hyper-personalization roadmap.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer:
Compared to other marketing automation tools in the market, Braze has one of the most intuitive, user-friendly interface which makes building a complex customer journey easy. While it takes some time to understand the documentation, the use cases are generally clear and easy to follow.

The biggest shoutout to the success of using Braze attributes to the amazing onboarding and customer success team members who have been instrumental in providing training and guidance steps, which are both critical to the adoption of the platform at an Enterprise level in less than 6 months!

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer:
There is a learning curve to using Braze, and as with all platforms, it is not easy to drive it forward in the beginning. An example would be the understanding of using Liquid to harass the full capability of personalization in Braze, but for an uninitiated marketer, that would be a very daunting step to overcome. While there are different ways to configure a setup in Braze, the more elegant approach or solution would usually require some development help or technical support (e.g building of APIs or data ETLs) which might not be at the disposal of every marketing team.

That said, there are still good low-lift solutions which are native to Braze and could be implemented with the support of Braze onboarding and the customer success team. I would strongly recommend it due to their high level of commitment to success.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Braze is an all-in-one customer engagement tool which allows the team to effortlessly orchestrate multi-marketing channels (i.e. Email, SMS, IAM, Push notifications) in a single customer journey view and the ability to scale up with different experimentations designs using drag-and-drop features. Implementing Braze SDK (by collecting data points) into our mobile app/website has also enabled us to transit from the current tactical campaigns to building more data-driven, customer-centric customer lifecycle campaigns. Another big plus of using Braze is how the platform ingests data that allows content personalization on the fly (via APIs) that supercharges our hyper-personalization roadmap.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze makes scheduling messaging extremely easy, and I really enjoy using it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
My favorite features are seeing the estimated audience reach for a message as well as the live preview of what this message will look like when sent. I also really like the ability to send test messages to myself and other people on my team. The system by which we add test users is intuitive enough and it makes it easy for us to see what our messages will end up looking like once we send them to our users. I also like that Braze makes it easy to target either users of Android or iOS, or both groups combined; this is especially useful considering some of the technical differences presented by the two platforms.

What do you dislike about Braze?
In my opinion, Braze makes certain things a bit more confusing than they need to be. I'm not a fan of the fact that campaigns that are otherwise finished but unlaunched don't automatically get saved as drafts, which has led to confusion in the past. Overall, certain things could definitely be made more intuitive than they already are (but at the same time, Braze is very intuitive already so I can't complain too much about this). From a UI/UX perspective, I sometimes wish I was able to edit more options on a single page view, rather than having to go through each individual step every time I'm building a campaign.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm unfamiliar with the previous system our company used to send out push alerts/messages if there were any. At this point in time, however, I don't believe we have any other way to achieve this. Braze allows me to meet my stakeholders' expectations regarding push notifications and in-app messaging, allowing us to reach our audience more effectively and let them know about what we have available for their enjoyment. Without Braze, we would have no way of directly reaching out to our users.

all_reviews.review_title: A versatile engagement platform that is always improving
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Product is constantly improving and our customer success manager is always interested in our feedback, plus letting us know about product roadmap items.

Canvas Flow is an excellent user journey orchestration tool that allows you to build user journey flows as simple or complicated as you need without requiring considerable uplift.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The search function is still poor, requiring you to use strict naming conventions. If you don't do this, it is hard to find campaigns, especially if they have similar names. Unfortunately, this problem has existed for years with no improvement

The lack of autosave in Canvas/campaigns - sometimes, you can forget to save changes which can cause you to lose work. It would be good to have the option to have auto-save on or off when working in a canvas.

The segment builder is still missing some much-needed filters. For example, it isn't possible to calculate the unique users that have entered a reoccurring weekly canvas in a given calendar month.

The simplicity of the platform can be a curse at times. Employees with less experience in the platform tend to have a false sense of confidence when building campaigns/canvases. This can lead to errors in builds that affect entries, sends, etc. This is easily be solved by staffing appropriately and putting in solid processes, but something that new users of Braze should be mindful of.

It is cumbersome to move members between canvases. Currently, this is achieved by webhooks, but this needs to change.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Increasing engagement - getting our app users to become more loyal during onboarding and throughout the user's lifecycle.
Better segmenting - enabling us to be more personalized in our communication to users.
Better data - using conversion events to track the success of our campaigns, whereas previously we would look at email or push engagement data.

Braze is both user-friendly and feature-packed, a rich platform that hasn't let me down so far. Working in the tool is a pleasure, and so is dealing with our support team: Alex Madda is everything one could want in a rep. Safe to say, I've found my professional happy place with Braze.

What do you dislike about Braze?
It's hard to find a negative. The closest I came is the inability to link directly to a template within the platform externally. One can link to campaigns, segments and canvasses - just seems like a missing piece that I'm sure will be updated eventually.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ease with which we can initiate a multi-channel strategy is a huge optimization boost.

all_reviews.review_title: My experience with Braze
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Main upsides of Braze:

- robust personalization capabilities which allow us to deliver highly relevant messaging to our customers
- truly an omnichannel solution that allows us to approach CRM strategy with a holistic multi-channel perspective
- appreciate that there are direct integrations with various partners (Segment, Heap, mailbakery, etc)
- large library of APIs and api-triggered capabilities which allows us to setup fully programmatic campaigns at scale
- good documentation and guides, along with the Bonfire user community makes for easier onboarding and troubleshooting
- really good support services, we've typically seen a 24-48 hour response time for our support tickets

What do you dislike about Braze?
-  "smart / intelligence" features don't work for us, e.g. intelligent send time feature has not proven to drive better engagement
- real-time alerting capabilities are lacking and makes it hard to monitor deployments
- the native performance reporting capabilities are a bit convoluted and don't solve reporting needs

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overall, I view Braze as an omnichannel messaging solution that allows us to approach CRM strategy holistically at a multi-channel level.  Braze's robust APIs and developer-friendly solutions enable us to setup key marketing automations and programmatic campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Marketing Automation Tool with Robust Customer Support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
As a customer of Braze, I feel they genuinely care about my feedback and are constantly looking to improve the platform. In the short year my company has been using Braze, I have already seen them make many great updates. We are able to use cross-channel campaigns to easily grow and scale our marketing efforts without having to onboard another tool. It also allows us to better understand all the communication our customers receive, and personalize each message.

One of the absolute best features of Braze is its people. I have had nothing but incredible support and service throughout my time as a customer. Whenever I have a question, someone can quickly answer it. The customer success team is first-class and provides great value to me as a power user. Not only are they helpful when it comes to learning how to do something new in Braze, or sanity-checking my campaigns, but they also push me to use more and more capabilities within the tool to unlocak as much value as possible. In addition, Braze has created many training resources and thorough documentation to help users accomplish just about anything within the tool.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There was a bit of a learning curve for me with Braze, having come from a less robust/technical ESP. Additionally, there is a bit more technical work required (I rely somewhat heavily on a Dev to get things done). However, with the learning curve came many new and exciting possibilities. The biggest thing that I had to get used to was that contacts are managed a bit differently - specifically they each require a unique identifier (aside from email).

Would love a bit more reporting, for example integration with Google Analytics to track true value of each campaign, but this is not the end of the world.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is allowing us to scale up to omnichannel marketing, which is new for our team! We are wanting to see all of our customer communication in one place. In addition, we are able to act on customer web behavior for the first time, which is leading to new marketing opportunities for us.

What do you dislike about Braze?
It is really expensive. Every new add-on, such as Braze Currents, is an additional fee. I wish Braze had a better and cleaner reporting dashboard. It is not very robust annd clunky, and I'm limited to viewing a few metrics that are pre-defined in Braze. To name a few, I would like to be able to build custom metrics, filter by conversion name, and be able to view unique link clicks in a table.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows me to experiment with subject lines and seamlessly roll out winning variants, reach customers through multiple channels within one platform, and launch lifecycle campaigns in less than a day without any engineering or design support.

all_reviews.review_title: Great product, but not always straight forward.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze has a great UI and is definitely user friendly. When it comes to setting up canvas's and campaigns it's really great! They also have a great help center.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I can think of a few small things that make using Braze a bit challenging. Staging and Production don't sync, so if you test in staging, you have to recreate everything all over again in prod. It would be great if there was a copy-over button. Also, when it comes to attaching templates to campaigns, they are entirely separate. If you update a template, you have to go and reattach it to the campaign; it would be nice if when a template was updated, the campaign was automatically updated as well. In addition, I wish there was a feature that would auto-save all your template, campaign, canvas and segment work every minute or 30 seconds. If you forget to hit save, you will lose all your work.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze simplifies the user journey with their canvas flow feature. It's so easy to use and includes so many options on how to actually use it. It's a great feature!

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer: Braze has a great UI and is definitely user friendly. When it comes to setting up canvas's and campaigns it's really great! They also have a great help center.

Staging and Production don't sync, so if you test in staging, you have to recreate everything all over again in prod. It would be great if there was a copy-over button. Also, when it comes to attaching templates to campaigns, they are entirely separate. If you update a template, you have to go and reattach it to the campaign; it would be nice if when a template was updated, the campaign was automatically updated as well. In addition, I wish there was a feature that would auto-save all your template, campaign, canvas and segment work every minute or 30 seconds. If you forget to hit save, you will lose all your work.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Braze simplifies the user journey with their canvas flow feature. It's so easy to use and includes so many options on how to actually use it. It's a great feature!

all_reviews.review_title: The UI is intuitive and hence user-friendly.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Being able to duplicate segments, canvases, campaigns is helpful. The ease of usage is also something I appreciate - whenever there're new features, it's easy to onboard and use.

What do you dislike about Braze?
It didn't use to be a problem, but recently, we've been experiencing slow-loading campaign/canvas pages. We figured it could be because we did not stop and archive the older campaigns and have started implementing that. We were also trying to extract copies and creative together with engagement data to do content analysis for optimisation, but there's no easy way now.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reliable sending of communications to our customers and users. We've now seen fewer delivery issues than when we used a previous tool. Productivity in the team has also increased because we no longer have to count segment size separately - we can immediately see the send segment size at the campaign level before send.

all_reviews.review_title: Allrounder - Tool for Email- & Automation Marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is very easy to use and navigate, with a decent amount of tools you can easily integrate. This makes Braze a reliable tool. You can also be actively involved in the improvement of the tool, which is very nice. So it's a great tool all around. So if you are looking for a solution for your product/marketing team to design customer communication efficiently and well, I recommend Braze.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are not many improvements, so I would ask to give Braze a 10, just some small suggestions.
For example, I'm used to tools auto-saving campaigns/canvases/any changes, but Braze does not do that. That sometimes causes extra work since the changes are gone, when you forget to save your changes. What also plays into that is that Braze logs you out after some hours and if you forget to save anything, it's gone.
Another point is that when you launched a campaign, you can't change everything (even when the campaign/canvas was not sent out yet).
Also worth mentioning is that Braze is quite expensive and hardly affordable for smaller startups.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
I don't know if they are working on the things I would like to have changed, but I put in some requests and waiting for them to implement them. Good that they always come up to you when they released a new tool.

Braze is easy to use and straightforward as long as the integration is done right. Thankfully the tutorials come in handy for new users, and the documentation is thorough. The CSM are very knowledgeable and give plenty of tips that will help you go a long way.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are a few limitations in terms of reporting, but braze is always working on new updates and features that keep us excited. There are some unique use cases that can be a bit of a roadblocker and the braze bonfire community helps does help overcome that challenge.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easy to create a complex canvas to meet our users demands. From the moment they sign up to a successful transaction. It helps that braze understands our user behavior really well so targeting our users with unique and personalized multichannel marketing campaigns is benefiting us in a great way. Love the fact that they allow you even to compare your canvases and campaigns to see how each is performing.

all_reviews.review_title: Senior Growth Marketing Manager
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze allows us to create fairly complex messaging experiences for our customers that are personalized and tailored to their own unique experiences. The fact that it works well with Amplitude and Snowflake are a huge plus, as lots of our existing data lives there, and is required to power these experiences.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is not what I would call an intuitive or easy-to-use platform. It also lacks the kind of in-product support, guides, and prompts you might expect from a platform that is not user-friendly out of the box. That means our team frequently relies on Braze documentation to accomplish tasks in Braze or to integrate our stack into their platform. Unfortunately, Braze's documentation leaves much to be desired and usually contains very little helpful information. That leaves our team stuck and forced to reach out to Braze Support, which is inconsistent. Also, because Braze does not own any of its own proprietary messaging technology, troubleshooting issues with one channel or another is often quite difficult.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching the right customer with the right message at the right time, all while we scale our user base and our internal team of Product, Growth Marketing, and Data folks.

all_reviews.review_title: The most complete tool for data and CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze's documentation is very rich. For any question, there is always an answer within the documentation, and this makes a big difference in optimizing my time.

I also like the many ways I can create a one-off campaign or journey. It took time, but I understand that Braze gives you several ways to solve your problem.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Lack of visualization of a journey. There is a platform in Brazil called Dito. This platform consists of designing a journey in a drag and drog manner, with communications already established at the first moment. In our company, as we have a lot of communications several times a day, Frequency Capping helps, but it's tricky to figure out the hooks of the journey and if they mix. I mentioned Dito because the way the journey is built (with the option to be 100% visual) would transform our routine into something more efficient.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Engagement Reports for sure! This report is incredible, and when he entered the platform, we just had to celebrate with fireworks! This solution will be put to good use when it reaches all channels besides email.

all_reviews.review_title: Were you looking for the best Customer Engagement Platform? Stop!!! You found Braze.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The Completed customer engagement flow with welcoming, recommendations, promotions, cart push, and confirmation emails, specially configured for each platform and app.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Low-level organizing of the Administrative Console
Manage Company Users

No search option to find the users. In cases when you need to check the company users, you must use control+F and find the name on the web page.

When you add a new user, Default permission is Company Admin level, not a secure way to protect the workspace and keep sensitive corporate information.
In case when the service is managed by Marketing team members who aren't technical people in data protection, cyber security, and access management, you will have a problem.

The user list fields and columns are not manageable, and they cannot filter users, emails, or their activity (last sign-in into the system) by A-Z format. Users add in chaotic and not based on the alphabet.

Security and SSO

Haven't an alternative sign-in method for Administrators to avoid SSO (in case your SSO is down and you need a switch to the sign-in process for users), you need to contact support and wait for their response while your business is stopped.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
With the customer engagement platform as a service, our product can ingest and process customer data in real-time, orchestrate and optimize marketing campaigns and evolve customer engagement procedures.

all_reviews.review_title: Intuitive and powerful platform tool leveraging easy connections and enabling efficient use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze has an incredible development team and support network, constantly working hard to deliver a 5-star experience. From top-end development of the product offerings to resolution of the simplest of beginner queries, Braze is always on hand and ready to help, enjoying working together to resolve and improve all aspects of the platform and user experience.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Some of the more technical aspects seen in other platforms like data manipulation on the fly (SQL/JS/Dimension Tables etc.) aren't as widely available within Braze. Although you can format variables easily with Liquid syntax and create vivid dynamic content with tools like 'Catalogs' and 'Connected Content', it does force the product owners to consider using a customer data platform to do the heavy lifting. In my opinion, this is a preferred method anyway, ensuring that any data present in Braze to be used in displayed content, is in its final format upon arrival. So it does move this aspect of data control further upstream, but then equally enables the end user to create more freely and efficiently.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze can solve many problems for many different business goals - predominantly focussed around interconnecting platforms or toolsets and moving you towards a centralised and governed approach to your marketing data and content. For example, based on client feedback, Braze Development Team recently updated the connected content data pipeline. This update enabled a clearer reporting picture of the sub-level control groups being applied within a Canvas Flow. This level of commitment and desire to achieve results always keeps me coming back to Braze with a smile.

all_reviews.review_title: New user of the newest ESP in town
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Positive UI and UX. Easy to navigate around the site, and lots of documentation is provided on the Braze site. Positive experience with customer support as well as their ticketing software

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are hiccups/bugs that we encounter at least once a month. This is somewhat expected since they are the newer platform compared to Oracle/Salesforce, but it can be frustrating.

all_reviews.review_title: Very useful and friendly UI, and the Support team is timely and detailed.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I like the ability to review analytics within the platform itself, the ability to QA by user search, and ability to test using API sends. All of this makes for a friendly implementation + testing experience.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wish there was a way to better understand where testing is failing. I would also like to know where live / active Brazes fail, since it's hard to QA when live. I wish we could follow one member through a Canvas flow in an easier view.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Exit canvas criteria. I think this improvement will help benefit me, as i often create hacky solutions to have members exit by using Audience Paths --> accept then everyone else as exit.

all_reviews.review_title: Solid Offering
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Overall a pretty logically organized interface that's simple enough to self-teach.

What do you dislike about Braze?
We ran into lengthy issues testing new Roku IAM features, raising multiple support tickets before finally a new release resolved the issue. Felt like it could have been remediated more quickly with transparent feedback. But it was fixed at the end of the day, and understandable brand new feature sets aren't always the most stable.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
For now, it's essentially our CDP, but also what we use to communicate with customers via IAM, push, and e-mail. Without Braze we'd have to find a new solution or build our own, which would be costly and not the most effective use of resources.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze CRM Platform Review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze does a great job of making the execution of all CRM outreach very simple with a great UX. Whether its a simple one-off campaign or a complicated multi-step, multi-channel user journey - building out the segment and the canvas logic is simple and intuitive.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Getting the performance data can be a difficult process. Often the needs of how the data needs to be analyzed or even found can be cumbersome to do in Braze and often requires data to be manually pulled from the campaign level and plotted into spreadsheets to be truly useable.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows my team to build and deploy marketing campaigns via traditional CRM/Lifecycle channels while also allowing us to help drive better-retargeting performance advertising by using our first-party data to personalize paid media based on where people are in the customer lifecycle in real-time.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Utilizing the segmentation functionality provided by Braze, we have been able to accurately target the specific customers that are of interest to us. This precision has been further enhanced through dynamic segmentations executed via their API.

What do you dislike about Braze?
For newcomers to marketing automation, mastering the basics of Braze might pose a significant challenge at first due to its steep learning curve. Additionally, the pricing model might be somewhat daunting and could dissuade small businesses or budget-constrained startups from fully adopting the platform.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's allowing us to target exactly the customers that we want to reach and personalizing the email communication using the data that we're sending through their API.

all_reviews.review_title: Great canvas flows to support complex, personalised user journeys
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The flexibility of canvas flow to build personalised user journeys.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The limitations of canvas flow compared to classic canvas editor should be highlighted more in the feature e.g. users automatically exit the canvas when they reach the last step in a canvas, unless lots of delays are added in. This means if you want to add to your journey you need to duplicate the canvas or create additional ones that are linked to.

Braze is missing some really basic features like auto save. It also logs out often. This can delete hours of work on cavases and campaigns.

Braze does not enable you to turn an email that has been created in a canvas/campaign into a template, or transfer emails from a canvas to a campaign and vice versa without downloading and reuploading as a HTML version.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Sending personalised communications to users based on unique attributes or custom events.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is a Game-Changer for Marketing Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is incredibly powerful. It far surpasses the email and push automation tools we were using. The company's onboarding support is up there with the best I've ever experienced from a MarTech SaaS tool, which made what is a highly detailed implementation process as smooth as possible. That enabled us to get Braze up and running in time for peak season, which dramatically improved our results.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Getting the tool up and running is not for the faint of heart. You have to have adequate resources, especially on your development team. You really have to understand API and SDK implementation to get the most out of the tool.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us tackle lifecycle marketing, engagement and retention. It gives us a complete picture of our customer base, including what action(s) they take with our tools. Armed with that data, we're able to set up sophisticated automation to improve the Customer Experience, keep customers more engaged, provide more value and achieve key business outcomes.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy friendly tool that can shift your marketing strategies positively
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I primarily work with Braze for push notifications and in-app messages. What I love about it are the various models we can use for in-app messages and the flexibility to create any personalised message we want for any objective we intend. We can tailor our campaigns using those in-app messages depending on the scenario and purpose. For example, we can use surveys to collect first-party data and models with two options to gather information on user preferences. I love the easy way we can build those messages and, even better, the easy way to collect these data.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are not many downsides of braze that I can think of. What can be very helpful for companies with multiple brands is to clone canvas from one brand to another to reduce manual work.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping me reduce the number of anonymous users, but enabling me to send in-app messages at specific times in their journey, prompting them to log-in.

Braze is an easy-to-use tool with a modern design, unlike other CRMs competitors. It can be used by anyone, without SQL or development skills.

What do you dislike about Braze?
We need to be able to integrate it with other areas such as Customer Service, Media or Social Networks, to make it a 360o tool and to be able to make more personalised flows based on more aspects of the customer.

all_reviews.review_title: Lots of features, overly simplified
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Quick and easy for basic use cases, there are a lot of efforts to streamline the use of the systems tools in accordance with best practices; it also benefits from a great community and a lot of useful content and updates.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Lack of basic functionality, you often end up clicking around a lot in order to do something such as a more complex audience filter/segment, you can't do things like duplicate very easily. There is in general a lot of clunky UI which other software such as Bloomreach (Exponea) has simply refined to a much higher standard. You do need a good understanding of liquid to do a lot of things which could have simply been made available as clickable options.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's an accessible and adaptable tool for engaging with people and can be set up to be extremely responsive and targeted for lots of complex multi channel marketing campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Highly-customizable platform with tons of features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze makes it very easy to both set up recurring workflows (canvases) and have one-off campaigns. We were able to customize our instance to fit our specific needs and pull in our own data to segment and customize with.

User-friendly platform. It takes a little bit to learn, but once you get it down you can spin up campaigns in minutes and customize it as much as you want. You may need a developer on hand if you have any complicated email formats, but once you have the template you can clone and edit it very easily.

Our CSM is also very good. He is always willing to jump on calls to talk through strategy and best practices, as well as keeping us up to date on the latest features.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Great tool, but the reporting is a bit lacking. Not a big deal for us since we report out of GA using UTMs, but would be nice to have something within the platform. Also, searching for previous campaigns can be a bit of a pain if you don't know that you can use search operators like you can in Google. I found this out and made it much easier to find the campaigns I was looking for.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to onboard our new users through email and push as well as cross/up-sell them. It makes the customer journey much cleaner than what we had previously and we are able to monetize our users much quicker and efficiently. By being able to customize the canvases and run A/B tests, we've been able to easily identify winning variants to use as our defaults and keep improving our conversion rates.

Before, we weren't doing any push notifications, but now we are able to customize them based on user's actions and custom properties, making them be v ery relevant to the recipient.

Braze makes it very easy to both set up recurring workflows (canvases) and have one-off campaigns. We were able to customize our instance to fit our specific needs and pull in our own data to segment and customize with.

User-friendly platform. It takes a little bit to learn, but once you get it down you can spin up campaigns in minutes and customize it as much as you want. You may need a developer on hand if you have any complicated email formats, but once you have the template you can clone and edit it very easily.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Segmentation within the platform can be a little hard to navigate. Additionally, the fact that messages are not auto-saving as I go is frustrating- I've lost hours worth of work because of this the first time I set up an email because the whole time I thought it was auto-saving.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easily reaching out to all segments in a personalized way and not just batching and blasting. Braze has a good way of determining opportunities for those we haven't reached out to.

all_reviews.review_title: Most Intuitive ESP I've Used
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The user interface is not only aesthetically pleasing but is very intuitive and dynamic as well. Likewise, if there's something I have trouble finding, the various guides and labs are beneficial in supplementing my knowledge.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Having to navigate outside of the editor to save is, at times, tedious. The inbox vision is finicky to work with, whether previews render differently from inbox tests or I have to save and rerun the test every time I edit my email.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Segmentation, data display, and a collaborative interface are all vital to my day-to-day work in Braze. Data imports into Braze are seamless, and targeting is made simple, with list logic being extremely straightforward. Some ESP's have a much more convoluted data display where Braze effectively outlines data for quick review.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
An excellent platform for notifying and sending notifications to your customers and prospects. You can automate a lot of complex user journeys using canvas flows, which is the best part. Seamless integration with multiple Martech stacks is a great feature.

What do you dislike about Braze?
With a lot of data flow over time, the tool might feel slow at times. Also, while editing the campaigns or canvas, it does not autosave anything, so if you missed saving, your effort is lost.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is solving my customer engagement and retention usecase. I can engage my customers using Push, Email, In-app, SMS etc. At the same time, I can create reports and dashboards to have a clear visibility of my user behaviour.

Estimating the audience is great, and the canvas tool is the best! It really makes setting up campaigns easy. There are lots of documentation and how-to videos online.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I don't like that you can't delete specific items. Instead, you have to archive them. Autosave would also be a nice feature to add. Nothing worse than working on a campaign that doesn't autosave and having to start over.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us market to our clients at the right time. We are able to reach a plethora of clients productively and with accurate communications. Our marketing ROI has also increased after using Braze.

all_reviews.review_title: Have been using Braze for a little over a year now
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The idea behind multi-channel canvases (or customer journeys) is great. We've been able to uplevel our customer marketing efforts because of this, and I think there's still a lot for us to unlock as we continue to grow as a company.

What do you dislike about Braze?
We rely heavily on email and can say this isn't a replacement for a CRM. There are very nuanced things that come standard in CRMs that Braze still needs to work on. Things like manually enrolling users in canvas, for example.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating more profound and personal relationships with our users in an automated and scalable way. We have a relatively complex product and Braze allows us to be clearer with our messaging so our customers can be more successful on the platform.

all_reviews.review_title: My favorite ESP to date.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is an incredibly effective tool for sharing all of our cross-channel messaging and impactfully segmenting these users. With Braze, we have utilized the tools they provide to create an ideal messaging cadence for our customers, depending upon their specific actions. I love how Braze is constantly iterating and launching an abundance of tools/new features to make the product even better.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are very minimal things I dislike about Braze - and for someone who has worked with many ESPs in my career, that's saying something. I find the Braze analytics to be a bit off, so it's hard to trust the results within the platform for engagement metrics. While this is something there are clearly workarounds for, it would be nice to have the data accuracy within the Braze dashboards. Finally, I enjoyed the V1 version of their Canvas Creation tool and am sad it is being deprecated. I completely understand why, but I'm excited to implement V2 fully.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
As I mentioned above, we have used Braze to change our messaging frequency schedule completely. We also utilize the tool, which allows us to A/B test messaging frequency and copy, then send the remainder of our users the test winner. Braze can handle most of the complex tests and experimentation ideas we develop in-house.
