review_question_answers.answer: Braze is an incredibly effective tool for sharing all of our cross-channel messaging and impactfully segmenting these users. With Braze, we have utilized the tools they provide to create an ideal messaging cadence for our customers, depending upon their specific actions. I love how Braze is constantly iterating and launching an abundance of tools/new features to make the product even better.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer: There are very minimal things I dislike about Braze - and for someone who has worked with many ESPs in my career, that's saying something. I find the Braze analytics to be a bit off, so it's hard to trust the results within the platform for engagement metrics. While this is something there are clearly workarounds for, it would be nice to have the data accuracy within the Braze dashboards. Finally, I enjoyed the V1 version of their Canvas Creation tool and am sad it is being deprecated. I completely understand why, but I'm excited to implement V2 fully.

review_question_answers.answer: As I mentioned above, we have used Braze to change our messaging frequency schedule completely. We also utilize the tool, which allows us to A/B test messaging frequency and copy, then send the remainder of our users the test winner. Braze can handle most of the complex tests and experimentation ideas we develop in-house.

all_reviews.review_title: They're not kidding - you can start small and go big with Braze
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a very full-featured platform, but you can get started relatively quickly - and you don't need to learn a ton of features that you're not ready to use yet. Really enjoy their Slack community as well.

What do you dislike about Braze?
It's pretty expensive and you're using whitelabeled ESPs, so it can be hard to get direct answers/deeper email data. We had a deliverability issue that ended up being due to a new version of our ESP and it took quite a while for us to sort out.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Braze to message our app users - through email, in-app, and push - with a focus on engagement, conversion, & retention. Our lifecycle marketing program is run pretty much entirely through Braze.

review_question_answers.answer: Braze is a very full-featured platform, but you can get started relatively quickly - and you don't need to learn a ton of features that you're not ready to use yet. Really enjoy their Slack community as well.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer: It's pretty expensive and you're using whitelabeled ESPs, so it can be hard to get direct answers/deeper email data. We had a deliverability issue that ended up being due to a new version of our ESP and it took quite a while for us to sort out.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We use Braze to message our app users - through email, in-app, and push - with a focus on engagement, conversion, & retention. Our lifecycle marketing program is run pretty much entirely through Braze.

all_reviews.review_title: Not user friendly but many available features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The push notifications and in-app messages look good. I also think that the people behind Braze are very kind and responsive, and knowledgeable. I also like that there is so much you can do on Braze, and some of it is intuitive but there is so much we still need to learn and that is difficult to navigate. I like that there are many features that we can use to enhance the promotion of our content.

What do you dislike about Braze?
It is inconsistent and requires a lot of backend work that isn't easy to get. It is also hard to figure out how to accomplish certain things on Braze. The Braze team is great but there is a disconnect because we are not computer engineers and don't understand certain things like advanced HTML and SDK. We want to make the most of our pushes to get users to watch our content but we are currently limited with what we can accomplish based on what we know.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's bringing more attention to our content via pushes. Especially for big premieres such as Yellowstone and the Challenge, and episodes binges it is very useful and we notice a lot of direct opens. It is helping our team receive more recognition for our work which in turn has us work harder at enhancing the experiences on our sites and apps. It motivates us to work harder to make is so that our users get to watch our content as soon as it airs.

What do you dislike about Braze?

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Would not recommend to a novice
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
It seems like there's a lot of ways to slice and dice audiences. I haven't yet run into an issue where I wanted to target a specific group of users based on an action and wasn't able to.

What do you dislike about Braze?
It is NOT user friendly. I've used other systems that have similar functionality to Braze (ex: Customer.io) and even though I was new to those systems, they were incredibly easy to figure out and start leveraging. One major issue I have is that whenever you set an onboarding flow live, you're unable to make any adjustments to the emails in the middle of the journey. If you want to do that, you either have to wipe out the existing content and add your new stuff in OR duplicate the entire flow and push ppl to the new one. It's absolutely ridiculous.

I find the Help Center to be fairly blah in how helpful it is -- I have had excellent success leveraging the Slack community, though. Very happy to see that resource available.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Ability to target users for in-app messaging and ability to build out onboarding emails. In both cases, it's helpful that everything from target audience to send schedule to the actual creative is in one single platform.

all_reviews.review_content:

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for cross-channel marketing with deep personalization capabilities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
- Supports key marketing channels: email, SMS, push notifications, in-app notifications, web notifications, and more
- Great segmentation capabilities that allow for complex personalization
- Out-of-box integrations with key tools like FB/Google for acquisition, Looker and Segment
- Constantly releasing new product features
- Great Customer Support team
- Makes it easy for marketers to get a lot done without needing additional engineering support after initial integration (they provide webhook templates, pre-coded click and drag email builders, and more)

What do you dislike about Braze?
Not many cons to report other than that you have to be mindful of data allotment and usage in order to keep costs within your contract range. With the support of their team, however, you can plan for this thoroughly and they'll help you monitor data usage and potential overage fees proactively throughout the contract term.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze helps us to send personalized and timely messages, test messaging and creative, launch and test net-new marketing channels, and makes it easy for us to pass all of our data back into our core reporting systems.

all_reviews.review_title: New to Braze, excited about what's to come
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Since completing onboarding with Braze, I've been encouraged and pleased with the amount of strategic support they offer. It is great to have all of our direct-to-consumer digital marketing in one place and we've seen strong results from all of the data we have been using to inform FB and Google campaigns.

What do you dislike about Braze?
One of the downsides to Braze is the data point restrictions that are put in place. If you do not have a CDP centralizing your data, downstream impacts will affect pricing and your success.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us centralize all our messaging so we don't over-inundate users. It also allows us to send personalized messages and offers to users on their preferred channels.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Braze?

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Braze?

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Very easy and intuitive dashboard. Options to target users across email, push, mobile in-app, web in-desktop, SMS, and more. New users can be ready to send campaigns in a matter of hours. The huge resource & knowledge library and the helpful, skilled Support make creating any solution a breeze.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Some customization elements require the help of developers/engineers to pull off. There is a steep learning curve (but a rewarding one!) to achieving more advanced personalization use cases and implementing 3rd party data/content into Braze campaigns.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It enables Product Marketers to communicate with their users/customers at any point of their customer lifecycle journey - from creating the account to becoming a life-long loyal customer and advocate.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Associate Director of Affiliate Growth Marketing

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool that has a few downfalls.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The canvas creation tool allows me to create a hyper-personalized user experience through segmentation and custom attributes and events. Others do not allow data to be logged and used in such an extensive manner. Not only can you customize triggers to send communications or use customized segments, but Braze has built-in ones that allow you to do so based on interaction with the communication. A/B testing features with intelligent sending allows the variant with the best performance to automatically start sending to users.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The data and insights/metrics are not Braze's strongest suit as they log anonymous user profiles which distorts data that cannot be removed or prevented thus I cannot rely on it as a reporting tool. Braze does not clarify what everything means within the out-of-the-box insights, for example what is an MAU according to Braze, what is the definition of a session when it is logged. This makes understanding your data quite difficult nevermind the reporting of that data. A lot of it seems a bit inaccurate on dashboards. You also cannot create an automated email with performance insights to go out based on your conversion events. It sends out an automated performance report that cannot be customized and has data which is not very useful.

Templating is very rigid and it is hard to get the design exactly as you want it to be within the drag-and-drop editor. In-app messages and content cards are not very dynamic or have extensive design options unless you use HTML ones.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows us to send personalised and customized communications that are scalable through the use of great segmentation, custom attributes/events and liquid personalisation within communication. It allows us to orchestrate how users are onboarded and engage with our app, driving meaningful conversions defined by us.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful platform with an easy learning curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze's UI has to be one of the platform's most valuable assets. With Braze I can get an intern in here and train them on basic email/messaging construction in a matter of days, maybe a week tops. They have a host of integrations that make automation and segmenting your user base a breeze. If you have an idea for how to reach your users with owned media, Braze likely has a solution - I've yet to encounter something that I've wanted to do on email, sms, push, and been unable to create a campaign around that concept. The powers of this tool are more limited to your imagination rather than its own limitations!

What do you dislike about Braze?
Some simple things seem to fall through the cracks in their platform. IE if you have a draft campaign that you want the devs to test out in the staging environment, there is no way to duplicate that campaign from your production drafts into the staging environment. If you change a daily campaign's schedule to run on a day that it wasn't initially scheduled for, it will not send out the day you made the change - it will only start sending on that day the following week. However, things like this are small, and most have minor workarounds if you know how to navigate the platform. Additionally, their in-app analytics could use a lot of work. This doesn't matter too much, considering we have tracking tags and integrations with our BI tool linked up to everything, but for a quick analysis of a campaign's effectiveness, I usually find myself getting answers from another platform like Google Analytics or Looker.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze solves the issue that most people run into when their marketing stack gets to large - it consolidates owned media into one simple, easy-to-use platform. You can automate messaging, promotion, and transactions in Braze, saving you valuable time over competitors.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is a marketers most essential tool for multi-channel marketing & so much more.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is easy to use and SUPER user-friendly. It's very simple to learn and even with new features coming out every month, their customer success team is right there with you to help you learn in a timely manner. I appreciate the canvas tool to easily create various multi-channel messaging types in one canvas. Braze has so much to offer; we have not even grazed the surface. With monthly check-ins, you are sure to have your questions answered, get a pulse on how you're campaigns are doing compared to industry standards, and even talk about strategy and new ideas. There are often new features dropping to help you (& Braze) stay competitive.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sometimes, the support can be too generic. It is important to contact your customer success manager directly if you have a specific issue you need to be solved by a pro, especially for tests or high-impact campaigns. General support cannot always give you the care needed, but escalating to your CSM can help tremendously.
One downfall of Braze, in comparison to Marketo, is they do not offer landing pages. This has been a setback for us.
It is also hard to know when there will be a change within Braze product that will affect your campaigns. Whether it be a release change, feature update, etc. we have faced severe revenue decreases on occasion when issues happen. We never know in advance.

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
Do it, you will regret not chosing Braze in the future. U

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We serve in-product content cards and in-app messages which help guide our users to what's going on in-product and even drive them to make purchases. We also use deep-linking to serve those in-apps to in-product buttons on-click. We use Braze to send push notifications on the web and android because we do not have an iOS app. This is a big lever for us. We recently realized the potential benefit of using Braze for SMS messaging, too! Braze is the only way we send marketing messages to our customers and we are hopeful there is, even more, to do like WhatsApp and FB messaging. Braze is solving a real-time, intentional messaging problem that is cutting-edge and continually improving.

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool for marketers!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I really like how user-friendly Braze is. I was able to get onboarded very quickly, given how straightforward the tool is. I enjoy their segmentation capabilities and ability to create customer journeys using their canvas tool to visualize the flow. Great customer service: they have good documentation and our CSM is always attentive to all of our questions with quick follow-up to help us with any issues or provide us with guidance.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Reporting and analytics have room for improvement. We have to rely on our CSM to get data pulled that's too complex for us to pull directly from the dashboards. We are trying to grow our ongoing personalization triggers which fall within their canvas feature which doesn't have the best reporting. I feel that their reporting and analytics are best for one-time batch & blast campaigns.  I also wish they had a better way to prioritize campaigns.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Easily deploy campaigns across email and push notifications to drive engagement and revenue - increasing our personalization efforts and getting customers content related to their preferences.

all_reviews.review_title: A complete and intuitive platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is easy to learn, I just watched some videos in an afternoon and I was ready to use it the same day. I found very complete tutorials, and my company had templates ready for everything I needed, so it didn't have a steep learning curve at all.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I found braze sometimes is slow.
I found a workaround of having multiple tabs opened at the same time, so I start working in another campaign while I wait for the last one to be launched.
The platform could be faster and more fluid, but waiting times aren't dramatic.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Braze to launch in-app communications and incentivize users' behaviors via discount vouchers.
Braze allows me to be specific about the users I want to target using different attributes.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I would love to get more insights into performance on an overall level. Looking into a bigger group of mulitple canvas and ad-hoc campaigns, that we send to e.g. trial users.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Journey building where we mix channels (Newsletter, push and in-app), performance overview and it's easy to scale to new markets, because we can just 'add' a new market to our existing set-up without having to stop them and loose historic data.

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform for app based businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze's UI is easy to navigate and learn in a short amount of time. The best features are the in-app notification and push tools, its ability to show real-time test results in a convenient dashboard, and the Canvas Flow. Their team of CSMs is also thorough and helpful.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There is a limitation to how much you can report and monitor when looking at month-over-month metrics or database growth. The ability to pull reporting like this is almost non-existent unless you find a savvy solution within Braze's Segment tool. There is no ability to wrap date ranges around segment filters, and when there is, there's a limit to how much time is captured (usually 30 days). Their email builder is not the best I've used coming from Marketing Cloud and Marketo, so if your business relies more heavily on email marketing, this might not be the best option if you don't have a team that knows HTML. Braze primarily shines on mobile marketing.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is working to solve for the amount of time a user can look back on when monitoring performance. Their newly introduced Canvas Flow tool has made ongoing omnichannel customer journeys a breeze. I also appreciate their attention to the development of Braze Bonfire, a Slack community of Braze users to ask questions and solve problems.

Braze primarily shines on mobile marketing.

Have a platform for creating user life-cycles and communications in mobile applications, as well as having a campaign reporting system that monitors user conversions.

What do you dislike about Braze?

The flexibility on Segments creation.

The campaign flow it's easy to understand

all_reviews.review_title: Great Tool - Better Customer Support and Partnership
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze fits all the boxes on being a great tool that solves problems but where I believe they excel is partnering with their clients to rethink the implementation of previous strategies or approaches when it comes to communication/marketing. For our instance, this was not a transactional purchase from the POV of selecting a vendor but rather a partnership to leverage the Braze experts and also glean off where other Braze customers are finding success. The tool is flexible in that it serves basic use cases along with being able to handle more difficult uses cases.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Not many to date but if I had to knick pick that cost structure on data points is a "different" approach but has not been a major issue thus far.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Segmentation and the ability for super users to be less dependent on tech teams.

all_reviews.review_title: I think Braze is very user friendly put still has potential for product  improvements.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The Interface is very user-friendly, and there is the ability to integrate Braze with a lot of different tools

What do you dislike about Braze?
I don't like the inflexibility in the segmentation options. I feel like I am missing a few ways to catch everyone in a segment. For instance, If I want to send content cards to a specific segment with users who has run through a Canvas, the only option is to say that they entered the Canvas xx days ago, or last received a message xx days ago. It would be great to be able to add a last step of the Canvas catching everyone that has finished the canvas flow and putting them in a  segment.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main thing for us is that we can connect Braze to other platforms and tools, allowing us to track the content we push on those platforms.

The Canvas flow - it is super easy to build a user journey - you can easily overview the steps, and you can't miss an uncompleted or wrongly setup step as the system is going to flag it to you and won't let you release it until you update it accordingly.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sometimes when more people have a certain canvas/campaign open (which can easily happen in a bigger team and with a bigger project), the recently added changes might not be updated to the item

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us a lot when specifying our target audience when it comes to our conversion communications. With its intelligent timing feature, it helps us to reach users at their best and most active time slots - so we can get closer to our desired conversion target

all_reviews.review_title: Find any solution, no matter the use case.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
- Braze has built a platform that integrates all channels for a full CRM experience - SMS, email, app push, etc.

- The components (content blocks, templates, canvas) are flexible enough that we can solve for any idea.

- With a simple UI, this tool is easy to pick up. Dig in and you'll master it in no time.

- Support response times are incredibly quick.

- The platform is always improving and even has a portal where users can make suggestions. A tool built to fit my exact needs? Who could ask for more?

What do you dislike about Braze?
- Finding answers for unique use cases, especially around things like anonymous users, can take extra time. There's not a lot of documentation around these kinds of campaigns.

- The disconnect between dev and prod environments means 2x the work, which is a bummer.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
With excellent automation features, Braze handles our high-level sends to all customers. This helps our team zero in on a granular level and think strategy instead of dealing with daily campaign builds.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful software that is easy to use, yet features virtually endless capabilities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze makes creating mobile marketing campaigns a breeze (seriously -- it takes me about 20 minutes to train new colleagues on how to do the basics) yet there are so many ways to play with audience targeting and segmentation. On top of that, you can't get better customer support. I work in a niche industry, which means unique needs to reach a unique audience, and my customer success manager understands that. Anytime they make suggestions, it's always with my particular industry in mind and that's really appreciated.

What do you dislike about Braze?
My needs for reporting are pretty simple, so I don't mind what's offered with Braze reporting; however, the reports that Braze creates aren't the cleanest. Our data scientist sighs every time I send her one.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
My team does not have a lot of bandwidth to dedicate to mobile marketing, even though our app is important to us, so having a simple tool like Braze really helps us do a lot with very little time needed.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful and easy to use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze makes creating emails/app push notifications and sending them out easy and straigtforward. You can design  your email using drag and drop without much background knowledge of html coding.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sometimes there's a delay in the image-uploading process when creating an email. You also need to hit "insert" after uploading the image, which I forgot a couple of times as I assumed uploading means replacing/adding.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze helps me create emails and push notifications with ease. The UI is simple and user-friendly; you immediately see what you put in. It saves me time learning HTML coding and I don't need to worry about messing up with the codes.

all_reviews.review_title: Best in Class CRM Platform and Outstanding Support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
User-friendly interface: The Braze UI is very user-friendly, making setting up even the most complex customer journeys a breeze. Other departments in the organization love the tool and are able to easily navigate the dashboard.

Excellent support: Braze's success team has become invaluable to our team. The insight, strategy, and guidance they provide helps us to continue to improve our customer engagement program. They also keep us up-to-date on the latest product releases and features to be sure we're utilizing all Braze has to offer.

In-depth campaign creation: With Braze, we're able to send the type of message we want, to the users we want, at the exact time we want. The functionality to customize campaigns with Liquid has been a game changer, providing relevant content to our users at precisely the right time, cutting back on clutter and streamlining our messaging.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There is nothing I dislike with the platform, but I would love to see an improved reporting tool, and maybe an updated way to sort/organize campaigns in the dashboard. We also have multiple marketers in the tool at once, so it could be helpful to have a flag that another user is making edits to a campaign as to not overlap progress.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows us to promote additional product features and educate our users to improve the customer experience. It also allows us to communicate important messages to millions of users at the exact time they need to know the information, reducing friction. We are able to create cross-channel messaging that is both meaningful and effective.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I really like that it's been designed for multiple channels by nature (emails, push, SMS etc.) and that it works very well for many stacks/tech architectures (from quick plug-in with Shopify to custom API).

What do you dislike about Braze?
I don't like some of the limitations Braze puts in place in terms of data consumption or segment builds. It would also be much more efficient to have access to chat support (like many other CRM tolls) to fix quick issues.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze helps us have a holistic view on what we are sending to our users. It helps make sure our communications are tailored and adapted to each individual across multiple channels.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool with lots of customization available
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a powerful tool with a ton of customization available in terms of attributes and events to personalize and trigger communications. They also have the ability to connect to other channels they don't offer themselves such as direct mail, phone, two-way SMS etc.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze should offer live customer support instead of only email support. Additionally, due to the ability to customize ideally the CRM team has a dedicate Braze engineer to help with these customizations - Braze should truly offer engineering support. It's an easy win-win for the client and them.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us reach the right audience at the right time with the right channel.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful but still scrappy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
There is loads of flexibility to be able to orchestrate endless scenarios. Braze also seems to be regularly evolving the product with new functionality rather than only refining the existing stuff.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Reporting and analytics is a fairly large gap at the moment. There is a lot of useful raw data available through their APIs to build out your own analytics or connect to an analytics tool, but within the UI there's fairly subpar analytics at the moment. I'm confident that this will improve though.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows me to deliver great marketing messages in a highly targeted manner with a great level of flexibility. It's how we communicate with users outside of the core product experience, and in some cases it also powers the product experience.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Overall, campaign and canvas analytics is not available but it is one of the most crucial things for us. It could be better to create an overall analytics page where we can see the big picture for selected metrics for the selected period with channel filtering.

Braze is helping us to set up transactional and marketing campaigns that drive incremental orders and users. Thanks to Braze, we are more productive, and CRM initiatives drive more revenue.

all_reviews.review_title: Loving Braze So Far
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze has been an excellent marketing tool for our team helping us deliver timely, personalized, and relevant content to clients. The UI, user experience, ability to segment, Braze's automation tools, channels, and ability to use Liquid to create logic within emails, push notifications, and in-app modals have helped me become more self-serve and a more independent marketer.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I would love additional trigger options for in-app modals (updates app to X version) and more use-case examples in Braze to understand its full capabilities, though Braze Bonfire has been a big help!

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze helps the company deliver timely content through relevant channels while leveraging the use of personalization, segments, and automation via Canvas, and helps reduce error by providing audience sizes in real-time.

all_reviews.review_content:

Braze is intuitive, easy to use, and quick to pick up. I enjoy the features that allow me to scale my automations with ease. I consider Braze's UI more straight-forward than it's competitors.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I dislike that Braze does not offer on-demand customer service. At times, emailing support can feel like your worries have ventured into a blackhole. I would love to see an iteration of Braze that offers part-time chat-based customer support.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze helps us connect with our users in the most timely and intuitive ways possible. Features like Intelligent Timing, Channels, and Selection all ensure we're doing our absolute best to be cognizant of how and when our users wish to be communicated with.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Experience for Engaging Users
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze provides a vast depth of options to engage your audience, and they're constantly expanding. The documentation provided is thorough and valuable. All interactions with the support team have been excellent, and Braze delivers a clean platform for engineers and marketers to engage users.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is almost entirely dependent on its dashboard. This can cause minor frustrations when you want to be able to export error logs but have to sift through a page instead of a cURL response.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is solving the problem of engaging users across multiple platforms. This is a benefit because my users are spread across three apps, a website, and the entire globe, and I can easily target and understand users for engagement.

all_reviews.review_title: I am very satisfied with Braze.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze has a great UI that makes it easy to track metrics and report on campaigns. Campaign configuration is also very seamless. Drip series are quite easy to set up via Canvas. I also really like all of the learning materials that Braze offers.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are a few minor things that could be improved upon. For example, when you need to add certain identical custom attributes or events in bulk, I wish there was an option to duplicate the selected attribute/event instead of having to find it manually each time.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze allows us to build a comprehensive lifecycle for our users and makes it easy to personalize our campaigns, test various iterations of our campaigns, automate them, and keep track of how everything is performing.

all_reviews.review_title: Very good
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Its intuitive. I had never worked with any platform of software to send pushes, but at the moment I started a few months back, I needed very little training and got started really quick.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wouldn't say I like the presets of Pacing. At some points, I would like to target fewer people or some intermediate values. Going from 50 to 100, to 500, to 1000. What if I wanted a more detailed experience? Target 850 pushes per minute, for example.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us deliver pushes to users and keep track of information about the campaign's conversion. It's very handy to have all the information compiled into a report and even schedule it.

What do you dislike about Braze?
In Braze you can't really customize your own setting. For example, the limit of sending the messages is by n*2 increments 50, 100, 200.... As a startup, we must be careful of the messages sent because of server overload. I wish we can customize the messages sent.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Brazing is helping issues like finding the PMF, a/b testing, hypothesis testing, automations and solving localization issues. Braze is benefiting me and many others by creating jobs and expedited many process and helped us save over $125,000 annually.

all_reviews.review_title: A very powerful tool once you overcome the learning curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The Braze support and CS team is very good. I felt that we get adequate support from our reps which I do appreciate. I took a more roundabout way to learn the platform (since I have never used it before) and now feel pretty comfortable with it.

The platform's overwhelming features and capabilities are useful for someone who understands exactly how they want to execute their campaigns. I do like the new canvas experience feature

What do you dislike about Braze?
Building custom reporting on Braze is not as ideal as I'd like. Doesn't seem as cohesive as it should be and you cannot look at Canvas reporting in an intuitive way (that I know of) as compared to campaign reporting.

There are some interface inefficiencies which I'd like the Braze CX team to address. When providing translations for different languages, all the code exists under one area in which we have to manually add all that information. The problem is the increased risk of potential mistakes with alot of code needing to be added by the user. Instead, it would be nice just to have designated CX friendly areas to add the content we need for the respective language we select. The code should be "added" on the backend so the user can just deal with a more consumer friendly interface to minimize the potential for incorrect code or errors to be introduced.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is empowering the opportunity for us to create ore in-depth and complex customer lifecycle messaging journeys. The current problem we have right now is retention and user stickiness. We expect to improve this retention issue with the features that Braze has available to us.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is an essential part of our communication strategy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is an easy to use and incredibly powerful communication platform that enables our complext daily sends while also letting us leverage advanced personalization.

Our day to day rep is responsive, thoughtful, and well versed on the platform, helping us make best use of Braze and guiding us through our myriad use cases. Tech support has always been fast and thorough.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting out of advanced features like canvases can be unintuitive. Sometimes metrics like primary conversion events may be counted one way on the canvas itself, then another in an engagement report. This may be nuance we don't yet have full training on, but self-serving these tools has proven challenging so far.

The fact that getting data out of Braze into our other systems is a monetized feature is a downside, especially given that sending data into Braze is a base platform feature.

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
To make best use of this tool, make sure the data you collect is as robust as possible

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
As we work further toward personalizing all of our CRM touchpoints, Braze is well equipped to leverage our wealth of subscriber data.

Creating campaigns and canvases that use our data points is a very intuitive process.

all_reviews.review_title: A state of the art CRM tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We use Braze at Zattoo for all our ad-hoc and ongoing lifecycle campaigns. It's a great tool with a plethora of functionalities that allow us to depict any scenario we'd like while seamlessly integrating with other tools in our tech stack.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Some scenarios require a tech background or some further support from Braze tech reps in order to be realized.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our CRM is mainly focused on increasing the retention of our customers. We solve this by creating complex lifecycle CRM journeys throughout different CRM channels (such as email, IAMs, push, and content cards) that enable us better reach our users and thus fulfill our goals.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful with the right set up
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is flexible and allows us to target users, follow up easily, and reach folks across various channels. It also has pretty good integration support - at least for the things we need it to integrate with.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting is brutal - pretty much non-existent for what really matters. Can get around it by using another tool, just don't expect it here. I'd also like more ability to do thing with ad-hoc lists/targeting (have to have broader groups set-up - harder to target micro, one-off groups)

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation; ability to send notifications and emails. It also allows us to incorporate lead scoring for different user journeys.

all_reviews.review_title: Great platform & account support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
- Braze is extremely easy to use. The user interface is very easy to follow and takes little official training to use.
- For more complex or Braze specific elements, Braze has great documentation and training.
- We have a great account team which pushes our team to continue to improve our communications.
- Single platform and UI for many marketing channels - email, SMS, in-app messages, push

What do you dislike about Braze?
- The platform can be a bit slow to load, especially while working on Canvases
- Platform is not mobile friendly - difficult to check campaigns on the go
- It would be great to be able to see account specific metrics (# SMS messages sent/received) without having to reach out to account management

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze enables our team to quickly and easily execute campaigns across multiple channels. It also empowers our team to analyze parts campaigns without analytic support.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful multi-channel engagement platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze's platform allows me to be extremely efficient. I go to one place to do most of my work during the day. I can manage user journeys, create campaigns across various channels, and have advanced targeting and personalization.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze's reporting capabilities are lacking. I have to rely on manual reporting to understand the incremental impact of each campaign. Braze has built tools to help you examine high-level engagement reporting, but there's no holistic way to understand the cumulative effect of my lifecycle programming.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze has allowed me to build a lifecycle engine that supports every stage of the user journey, all in one convenient platform. My campaigns have a clear impact on business performance, driving both revenue and weekly engagement.

Braze has a super user friendly interface for any users to both set up, maintain and see the analytics of the campaigns so it's easier to optimize and test out new ideals easily

The canvas made complex set up of event trigger funnels intuitive and easy to understand and it is also easy to connect the tool with other tech stacks as its robust support and API functionalities

The user data is handled with care and it is really simple to use to set up user cohort or use for other targeting also

Highly recommended if you want to engage customer better as it works and is easy to use

What do you dislike about Braze?
We do also have web product also so would be good to have those cross platform engagement functionalities, it is a tricky challenge as it has different identifiers and different ways to engage customers, so want to make sure it will be working as expected to further boost retention across platforms

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It help us with both in app messaging, push notification and working on using it's email and messaging capabilities also

We set up mytiple campaigns on different touch point and it really significantly improved the user retention and boost monetization also

I also greatly appreciate the constant support we get from Braze team, as they're super fast when raising a ticket or any problem

What do you dislike about Braze?
It sometimes takes a bit of time to save or upgrade canvases leading to errors. It's a bit frustrating when this occurs because we sometimes have to re-do all the work because it didn't save properly.

Braze has also added a simplified canvas view allowing marketeers to show different departments what our campaigns or canvases look like without having to generate a separate draft. This was super useful for the team

all_reviews.review_content:

I like that we can create different segments and event, and automate campaigns in real time. The service that the team gives us is really fast and very attentive (close).

What do you dislike about Braze?
Something that we can improve is the negotiation of the incremental cost per MAU, since it is good to have more MAU's but every time they grow, it means a higher cost for us. We should have a lower cost per MAU the more we have of them. Another point is that Braze you have a Loyalty module /section and not CRM only.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We challenge the Braze team to give us benchmarks with other countries in the region, it is important to always look at others as well. The more information you can give us about our brands in the region, will be better!

all_reviews.review_title: Love it!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
There are many things I love about Braze, but the qualities I like the most are the easy-to-use interface, the informational user guides, the quick setting up of campaigns and segmentation.

What do you dislike about Braze?
I wish there were more tools available in the drag-and-drop template builder. For example, I can't change fonts or add additional code. Extras like that would make the experience worthwhile for someone who doesn't have much experience building templates with HTML/CSS and feels more comfortable using the drag-and-drop builder (such as an intern). Also, the reporting is so standard and a little janky. I would like to see more insights to analyze the results better.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer relationships and engagement are tremendous for our company since we are subscription-based. Therefore, we must be in constant contact with our audiences, and Braze allows us to do that with email, SMS, and much more.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Braze?

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Braze?
review_question_answers.answer: I wish there were more tools available in the drag-and-drop template builder. For example, I can't change fonts or add additional code. all_reviews.review_title: Engage your users at a higher level
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
- Centralize the point of sending communications (email, push, etc.) in a single platform
- Ease of integration with mobile applications and websites
- Ease of testing and debugging
- Possibility of creating advanced email templates without special development knowledge
- Quick and painless integration with other tools
- Continuous and prepared assistance by a dedicated team in Braze
- Complete and comprehensive training platform

What do you dislike about Braze?
- The reporting and analytics functionality should be enhanced. It is true that there are other tools (with which Braze is perfectly integrated), but having a more exhaustive panel of information would certainly be a plus.
- Improve the Drag and Drop email creation functionality

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Thanks to Braze, we were able to centralize all communications to our users in a single tool, which allows us to manage the various communication channels in a complete and widespread manner and to make decisions on how to improve them. Its user-friendly aspect has also allowed us to reduce the activities where the support of the development team is needed, making our marketing / CRM team more autonomous.

What do you dislike about Braze?

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Great omni-channel messaging platform for events based data, albeit a engineering intensive tool.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
- Omni-channel solutions
- Message customization with Liquid
- Events-based data and integration with Segment
- Connected Content - pull data into message via API
- Webhooking capabilities

What do you dislike about Braze?
- Lots of engineering required
- Poor reporting / need to export data to 3rd party analytics
- Inability to edit after message launch
- Inability to delete any messages

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Omni-channel solutions: messaging through email, SMS, push, in-app, etc.
- Segment integration, Connected Content, and webhook capabilities allow for a flexible platform and plays nice with other SAAS.  Data flow is fluid.
- Use of event properties and liquid customization within a message allows for complex criteria triggers for message sends.

all_reviews.review_title: A Reliable Partner in Push, SMS, Email and More
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The best thing about Braze is their reliability. You do not need to worry about things breaking or messages not sending. Their reporting is accurate so you can trust that you're getting the best data to make decisions with.

Other cool benefits:
- Intuitive, clean interface that marketers will be comfortable navigating
- Powerful personalization powered by liquid
- Everything is near-realtime, from triggering a custom event to seeing that data back on the dashboard is mere seconds.
- Customer journey orchestration with Canvasses allow for detailed customer experiences and a set-it-once and forget it ability

What do you dislike about Braze?
The features they build do not always align with the features that would be most useful to the marketer. They added an AI copywriting assistant that you could never genuinely use in production, but it sounds cool so that's probably why they did it. Their tech support is highly responsive, but has missed finding root-causes that our developers or even marketers have caught on their own, rendering them unhelpful.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are getting content and offers into the hands of customers at the right point in their journey, and getting massive amounts of data back to analyze and improve upon our marketing effectiveness. We are benefitting from clean data, highly segmentable and targetable audiences, and realtime triggers that create a unique journey and experience for every customer with minimal day-to-day manual intervention. This allows our marketing team to focus strategically and at a high level and not worry about keeping things running or dealing with issues, because with Braze everything just works!

all_reviews.review_title: A platform that will save you time, money, and enable data-led marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is a malleable platform, able to be tailored exactly to your business's broader infrastructure.
Snowflake data sharing enables you to link customer's behaviours and engagement with any personal or financial details that you may have sitting in other systems.
Communications are fully customisable (HTML friendly), allow you to implement complex logic to create personalised messaging and experiences based on a user's data, and span across a range of channels (not just traditional SMS and email).
IP's are your responsibility to manage, so your deliverability isn't harmed by other brands not holding to best practice.
Documentation is fantastic and readily available; layout of user interface is extremely intuitive and makes for easy upskilling.
Live support is always available when you need it, answers are relevant, timely, and bespoke to your business's requirements.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Multiple users can't work on the same template simultaneously (can lead to work being overwritten if communication between teams isn't clear on deployments).
Can't delete certain things, only archive.
Would be nice if canvas layouts weren't so rigid.

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
If you get Braze, I'd recommend investing in Snowflake as well.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've shifted from 50% deliverability of core messages to almost 100% overnight. This has raised our core conversions to purchase in some cases by 20% (some of the biggest increases we've ever seen).
Previously our data wasn't centralised or consistent in format. Shifting to Braze has allowed us to really clean up our data structures.
We'd never been able to send tailored messaging prior to working with Braze - now we can have one template work for multiple products and customer life stages.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is a world-class CRM for many types of companies
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I like the easy interface and the advanced personalization. I have used the personalization tools to create a variety of campaigns -- from personalization based on purchase history to their name to their account-type. It's really nice to have a platform that makes it easy to create campaigns that are engaging for your users. I also love that Braze comes out with new features often.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are certain features that you have to ask your CSM to enable for you on the account. I wish that 'beta' features were more visible or accessible to Braze users.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problems that Braze is solving are: onboarding new users, engaging with current users, and letting users know about new features, offers, and coupons that are available to them.

Additionally, the advanced technology within the Braze platform has allowed us to automate some of our more manual processes allowing us more time to focus on new strategy.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Nothing comes to mind, even when we have hit potential roadblocks, the Braze team was quick to identify resources we could use and offer assistance where possible.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is allowing us to achieve our 1:1 marketing goals - we have the ability to send to a customer on the right channel at the right time. It also solves our experimentation problems - we can now multivariate test on a campaign as well as within a customer journey, that's something we didn't have with our previous provider. We are also able to easily customize our messages to a local market.

I also really believe that Braze considers user feedback and devises ways to implement features that help the users. I have seen it myself in the SMS sector where requests made at my previous company have been implemented in my current company

It allows us to accurately and consistently engage with customers across multiple channels without having to use many other tools. Most functionality that a user could hope for is baked into Braze.

We are able to reach a full member funnel through braze with many different types of touchpoints (emails, texts, app pushes, app pop ups, etc). We can enroll new members, get them set up for success in the first 30 days, and then bring them back when they become inactive.

What do you dislike about Braze?

We are able to reach members to aren't enrolled with our product and get them signed up, and then reach them at critical points in their health journey so they can reach their goals (weight loss, stress reduction, blood sugar, etc).

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is the ultimate CRM Platform for any app!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze has all the functionality I need to maximize the performance and retention of users within my app. It allows me to easily create campaigns and flows that seamlessly switch between multiple channels liks email, SMS, in-app messages, and push notifications. The new user-friendly features like the drag & drop email builder make campaign creation easier than ever before.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The reporting tools and analytics within the platform could use some improvement. It should be easy to create custom reports across multiple channels, dates, and objective types - almost like creating audience segments, however, the report builder is quite limited and difficult to master. It is also difficult to be agile and quick when it comes to creating new custom events if/when a new app feature is released. As someone with a non-technical background, that would be a huge help to me and my team.

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
The support team is so talented and quick to respond to my tickets, day or night! They have helped me with simple, high level tasks as well as extremely intricate use cases that had no precedence. Their support team really does a fantastic job to ensure minimal hiccups during any project.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Braze, we can solve simple problems such as reminding users to finish an activity or giving us feedback with simple surveys. I have realized the level of intricacy one can create when designing the user journey via canvases.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent! Braze is super complete and easy to use
all_reviews.review_content:

- Data Extraction to our databases
- Easiness of the dashboard
- Braze SDK is very complete

What do you dislike about Braze?
- Price and billing plan (datapoints).
- Email orchestration and editor.
- No way to use "plugins" or external extensions inside Braze.
- Inapp messages could be better (product tours, customization without code, etc.)

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
- Even if it is easy to use, if you want to take the most of every penny invested, you need somebody to know about it.
- Before you buy it, make sure you have the tech resources and capabilities to integrate it.
- Be patient, it would be difficult to have the first campaign running in the first month :)
- Try to have all the data clear and not send everything to Braze.
- Invest in a marketing tech team that can manager the toool accordingly eee eeeeee e

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Automation of processes, messages and data
- Customer Engagement, marketing or transactional campaigns (email, push, inapp messages)
- Onboarding/Activation of users

all_reviews.review_title: Braze has ultimately changed the way we engage with our customers at a 1:1 level through digital
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The consistent ongoing support from Braze's success team has ultimately become the biggest asset when it comes to strategizing and executing within the platform.

What do you dislike about Braze?
While TCPA doesn't require a double opt-in process for SMS consent, it is still highly recommended. I think Braze should incorporate a required double opt-in field alongside the current required "opt-in" keyword category for SMS subscription groups. This would eliminate the need for brands to strategize extra canvas/campaign steps to incorporate messaging and user filtering.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our previous SMS platform was incapable of targeting specific audiences, while we had to send mass text blasts out to thousands of people at one time-ultimately causing low-performing campaigns and high opt-out rates with no real-time customer data. Braze has instantly solved this problem by being able to directly target audiences who were most likely to engage based on behavioral data while sending personalized SMS messages to our customers at the right time.

review_question_answers.answer: The consistent ongoing support from Braze's success team has ultimately become the biggest asset when it comes to strategizing and executing within the platform.

review_question_answers.answer: While TCPA doesn't require a double opt-in process for SMS consent, it is still highly recommended. This would eliminate the need for brands to strategize extra canvas/campaign steps to incorporate messaging and user filtering.

review_question_answers.answer: Our previous SMS platform was incapable of targeting specific audiences, while we had to send mass text blasts out to thousands of people at one time-ultimately causing low-performing campaigns and high opt-out rates with no real-time customer data. Braze has instantly solved this problem by being able to directly target audiences who were most likely to engage based on behavioral data while sending personalized SMS messages to our customers at the right time.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze - Quick to learn with lots of depth
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Easy to send a campaign out to the masses. A lot of configuration allows you to set up the campaign that you want.

What do you dislike about Braze?
A lot of pitfalls will render the campaign not firing or firing inaccurately. There are no checks in places, it really relies on the user to make sure the campaigns are properly set up.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps us target our marketing campaign to the users we want. It also allows for custom segmentation which is extremely important as we tailor these campaigns to different groups of users.

all_reviews.review_title: Third company where I use Braze and they still manage to amaze me
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
-Constant product innovation: They keep impressing me with how much they innovate every month, they are literally always adding useful new features, channels, and functionalities to their product
-User-friendly interface: Even though Braze is a really complex tool with tons of options, it is built in a way that is intuitive and easy to use.
-Personalization granularity within their campaigns thanks to their advanced segmentation options and Liquid scripting language to add multiple dynamic variables within a template.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There is nothing I really dislike, but I would suggest they start investing more effort into making their Churn Prediction and Purchase Prediction functions more advanced so their customers can really take churn prevention to the next level.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Among many other benefits, thanks to Braze we managed to automate most of our campaigns and journeys, reducing to 50% the operational efforts that the CRM team was investing with our previous tool. We also managed to increase our conversion rate against the global control group by 30% in a matter of months.

all_reviews.review_title: Great place for marketers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
It's pretty user friendly.

Campaign creation with A/B testing,  and Canvases. Canvases have been extremely helpful. I use them for onboarding journeys, multi-language notifications, and re-engagement campaigns. Once an ongoing/daily canvas flow is up and running, not only does it allow me time to 'step away' and check in, but I already have a template in place for duplication and future canvas creation.

What do you dislike about Braze?
- There are some targeting limitations that I'd love to see expanded (things with dates rangest etc)

- Would also love more even insights - It still is better for me to export the data into excel and use pivot tables

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching our users in new ways while we test out new potential recurring messages.

all_reviews.review_title: Very flexible tool and good UX
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
A lot of functionnalities, or ways to implement use cases. From Canvas/campaigns, segmentation creation and connected connected content. Overall quite intuitive to use. Also in general it's a trustworthy tool where things work the way they are advertised

What do you dislike about Braze?
It can be difficult to manage the large number of canvases/steps/campaigns/segments. Especially for example when we need to modify one thing for all of them.
Another problem is some lack of visibility when troubleshooting sometimes: i.e. why did this user not receive this step etc..

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We do all our CRM on Braze: Campaign creation, coordination
Segmentation strategy, some basic reporting. and all of our automated flows are built using canvases

all_reviews.review_title: Marketing automations made easy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Customer lifecycle journeys enable detailed navigation based on user attributes and behaviour. One of the functions that makes Braze stand out as a marketing automation tool is the Canvas.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Generally, Braze becomes slower over time. Long canvases (40+ days)  could get quite hard to edit and adjust. There are also some limitations when it comes to segmentation, there's a small limit to the number of segment extensions that could be live at a given time; those are an extra layer of detail that help target users based on specific behaviour.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Real-time segment estimation gives a lot of flexibility in discovering certain customer behaviours, which is extremely helpful for identifying market opportunities.

all_reviews.review_title: Best CRM around
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Intuitive UI makes it easy for marketers and engineers alike to work in the platform. Omnichannel coordination is second to none. This allows us to be able to interact with a customer on multiple pivot points in the customer's journey.

What do you dislike about Braze?
At times, the canvas can get bogged down. I also believe there should be documentation points included in the UI of the platform. Easy way to review docs at certain things. Ie setting up webhooks, added app groups etc.

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
Confirm that your legacy stack has a partner connection to Braze. This will make it easier to implement.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Understanding use journey and the complexities of A/B testing. There are never enough methods, times and variations to A/B multiple different messaging across all of the channels.

What do you dislike about Braze?

What do you dislike about Braze?

Searching for campaigns - it's difficult to quickly know which are completed - there is stopped/archived but those terms suggest a user purposely stopped/archived it. For example, under one time sends from months ago fall under All Active even though I consider them completed and not active.

Multi channel journeys for marketing efforts. Braze helps us unlock the most effective channels for each customer.

all_reviews.review_title: Project manager - Growth
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I really appreciate Braze customer service (Customer Success Manager / Julia and tech team!) They are always quick to reply and help us. Either for technical issue or for a question regarding a strategy.
Also, it's very easy to find information in their documentation and their lab are very well made for the onboarding!
So, in a short answer : the "Braze experience"

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is user centric (which is good for a lot of campaigns), but sometimes it can be problematic in some cases that we need to target a specific device.
Also, the platform is only in English.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a lot of data in the same platform / Braze. It's easy to retarget users based on their activity. Before we needed to export data from our CDP, then import it in a CSV.

Also, the platform is only in English.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We have a lot of data in the same platform / Braze. It's easy to retarget users based on their activity. Before we needed to export data from our CDP, then import it in a CSV.

all_reviews.review_title: Incredibly easy to use, very supportive and intuitive interface. Tons of possibility
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Braze is accessible to non-developers, and makes it EASY to share with our marketing partners. Really accessible analytics out of the box that means I want everyone to have access

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze is most effective when you have plenty of data in Braze with which to create campaigns. This is doable, and certainly worth it, but I'd love more opportunities to set up campaigns based on information that is *not* stored / passed to Braze.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is supporting a significant improvement in our Push channel - specifically they're giving us metrics that we didn't have access before (including custom metrics based on our definition of success), faster testing with message testing in directly in the Braze portal, and unique functionality that will improve our message relevancy (Connected Content, real time API calls)

all_reviews.review_content:

We're able to send push, in-app message, email well. The learning curve is reasonably friendly -- people can pick up the gist of it within a few days. It's well-integrated to other softwares as well.

What do you dislike about Braze?
it has minimal analytical capabilities, in thus requires supplemental resourcing to drive business decisions. Good execution tool, a bit wanting as an analytics or reporting tool.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze is helping us execute on CRM (Customer Relationship Management) needs. We want to reach our users via various channels, at specific points in their journey. Braze allows us to do that.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Sometimes we would like to edit an active canvas, or even delete a draft, but it's not possible yet. Also, recently we're facing some problems when editing a canvas in the classic mode (it changes the whole canvas visualization and the email's footer goes up).

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We realized we can save much of our time by letting some communications "Action Based". All the company is being more productive because we only have to monitor the results, but the dispatches are automatic.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
The ability to combine multiple channels  (SMS, Email, Push Notifications, Email) that are all geared at a single goal. This saves so much time as compared to setting things up in Twilio, SendGrid, etc.

What do you dislike about Braze?
The UI is a little clunky and can be intimidating for users who don't use Braze day-to-day. Also, without setting up one of the "currents" that sends data out of Braze - the reporting can be limited. Also, the survey functionality is limited.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem that Braze solves for us is that it saves us from having to coordinate campaigns across multiple tools that specialize and each go after one channel.

all_reviews.review_title: Braze Review and performance for a Retailer
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
We like its capabilities to automate and personalize marketing campaigns and then be able to analyze the results on amplitude to iterate and improve our metrics.

What do you dislike about Braze?
Braze should improve its reporting and enhance its ability to capture events for more than 60 days. They just released the cohort feature that allows us to create ten cohorts with at least a year of data but for us it still limits us with what we want to be able to achieve. That is one of the reassons we integrated amplitude because they don't have this limits so we create cohorts in amplitude and import them to braze so we can then contact those cohorts with marketing automation in out different channels (sms,email, push and app/web)

Recommendations to others considering Braze:
Braze is a fantastic marketing automation tool. If you want to personalize the customer experience and you are a retailer that has many skus , you should consider having amplitude for insights and reporting and also search for a recommendation engine to personalize all of your campaigns.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
We now are able to launch multiple personalized campaigns with a small marketing team.
We are also lowering our acquisition and retention costs.

all_reviews.review_title: An extensive set up process with lots of opportunities
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
Setting up messages is relatively straightforward and the Braze lab modules are very helpful.
Report builder is easy to use and can group campaigns easily, especially with tags.
Being able to add users and teams with limited permissions is helpful for franchisees and different regions.
The support team has been very helpful with identifying issues and offering guidance on setup issues as well.

What do you dislike about Braze?
There are a lot of unexplained sending issues that we've experienced with SMS and email.

There are a lot of functions that show even if we don't have data stored for those attributes. It would be nice if those would not show if we don't have data for the function setup. For example, if local timezone data isn't something we specifically have, it shouldn't show at all.

The revenue shown from each campaign doesn't seem entirely accurate. It would be great if there was a visualization of where the revenue is coming from and when for each campaign.

For users with limited access, it would be great if only the things they have access to show. For example, we only want franchisees to be able to draft messages, but they can still get lost in other tabs causing lots of confusion.

Overall, the process of setting up Braze to a point where we can actually use it was not what we expected. I think letting future clients know what the setup time for each messaging channel is (i.e. 2 months for SMS, 5 months for push, 8 months for email, etc) would be super helpful for gauging when to make changes to internal processes and systems.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
Braze has helped us send a variety of messages targetting segmented audiences, which has helped lower opt-out rates and increase conversions. Braze has also helped us manage a large number of keywords and build out segments to track subscribers in those keywords.

What do you dislike about Braze?

all_reviews.review_title: Braze is a great platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
I've been working within Braze for 2+ years, utilizing the majority of the available features. I've been extremely happy with the platform on multiple levels. The platform itself is the most intuitive one I've used in my 7 years within the MarTech industry. The interface is easy to use and navigate, the campaign & automation features are robust and Braze's endpoint is easy to use and well documented. I've also had wonderful experiences with our customer success managers over the years & ad hoc support. Highly recommend Braze for any company looking to bolster their digital marketing program.

What do you dislike about Braze?
My only dislikes are some aspects of the media management, especially when copying over a previous campaign but it is a minor gripe.

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
The beauty of Braze is that it offers flexibility in problem solving. Specifically, the Braze endpoint, coupled with the webhook feature allows for several ways to approach problems. We've been able to integrate with other platforms seamlessly and launch processes utilizing triggered events or 3rd party actions.

all_reviews.review_title: Multi-channel marketing platform + superb support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Braze?
* powerful multi-channel marketing platform, yet easy and intuitive to use
* strong segmentation capabilities
* canvas section allowing for sophisticated multi-channel & multi-language communication flows
* once set up properly it puts a powerful toolset in the hands of marketing while reducing dependencies on development resources
* the platform already offers more than we're making use of and it keeps developing further
* all of the above is enriched with a strong and committed support & services team that is dedicated to elevating your status quo

What do you dislike about Braze?
* in-platform reporting and analytics capabilities could be enriched
* also more and easier visibility on deliverability topics would be a big plus
* based on the latest pricing strategy you need to make sure you get the full personal support you can get as "platform access + team support" is the path to success!

What problems is Braze solving and how is that benefiting you?
* multi-channel, multi-language user communication to drive engagement and ultimately revenues
* being able to act independently within Marketing by reducing tech. and development dependencies
* making sure we're getting the most out of our installed base
* finding the right balance between over- and under-communication by delivering meaningful/relevant content to users at the right frequency
